1.verse: In the beginning was the word, and the word was at God, and God was the word. [In the beginning was the word, that is, God's Son, and the word was at God, and God was the word.]

2.verse: This was in the beginning at God.

3.verse: All things were made by him, and without him was made nothing [nought], that thing that was made.

4.verse: In him was life, and the life was the light of men;

5.verse: and the light shineth in darknesses, and [the] darknesses comprehended not it.

6.verse: A man was sent from God, to whom the name was John.

7.verse: This man came into witnessing, that he should bear witnessing of the light, that all men should believe by him.

8.verse: He was not that light, but that he should bear witnessing of the light.

9.verse: There was a very light, which lighteneth each man that cometh into this world [that lighteth each man coming into this world].

10.verse: He was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.

11.verse: He came into his own things, and his received him not.

12.verse: But how many ever received him, he gave to them power to be made the sons of God, to them that believe in his name;

13.verse: the which not of bloods [which not of bloods], neither of the will of flesh, neither of the will of man, but be born of God.

14.verse: And the word was made man, and dwelled among us, and we have seen the glory of him, as the glory of the one begotten Son of the Father, full of grace and of truth. [And the word, that is, God's Son, is made flesh, or man, and hath dwelled in us, and we have seen the glory of him, the glory as of the one begotten of the Father, the Son full of grace and truth.]

15.verse: John beareth witnessing of him, and crieth, and saith, This is he of whom I said, He that shall come after me, is made before me [saying, This it was, whom I said, He that cometh after me, is made before me], for he was before me;

16.verse: and of the plenty of him we all have taken, and grace for grace.

17.verse: For the law was given by Moses; but grace and truth is made by Jesus Christ.

18.verse: No man saw ever God [No man ever saw God], but the one begotten Son, that is in the bosom of the Father, he hath told out.

19.verse: And this is the witnessing of John, when Jews sent from Jerusalem priests and deacons to him, that they should ask him, Who art thou?

20.verse: [And] He acknowledged, and denied not, and he acknowledged, For I am not Christ.

21.verse: And they asked him, What then? Art thou Elias? And he said, I am not. Art thou a prophet [Art thou the prophet]? And he answered, Nay.

22.verse: Therefore they said to him, Who art thou? That we give an answer to these that sent us. What sayest thou of thyself?

23.verse: He said, I am a voice of a crier in desert [I am a voice of a man crying in desert], Dress ye the way of the Lord, as Esaias, the prophet, said.

24.verse: And they that were sent, were of the Pharisees.

25.verse: And they asked him, and said to him, What then baptizest thou, if thou art not Christ, neither Elias, neither a prophet?

26.verse: John answered to them, and said [saying], I baptize in water, but in the middle of you hath stand one, that ye know not [whom ye know not];

27.verse: he it is, that shall come after me [he it is, that is to coming after me], that was made before me, of whom I am not worthy to loose the thong of his shoe.

28.verse: These things were done in Bethany beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.

29.verse: Another day John saw Jesus coming to him, and he said, Lo! the lamb of God; lo! he that doeth away the sins of the world.

30.verse: This is he, that I said of, After me is come a man [This is he, of whom I said, After me cometh a man], which was made before me; for he was rather than I.

31.verse: And I knew him not, but that he be showed in Israel, therefore I came baptizing in water.

32.verse: And John bare witnessing, and said, I saw the Spirit coming down as a culver from heaven, and dwelled on him. [And John bare witnessing, saying, For I saw the Spirit coming down, as a culver from heaven, and dwelling upon him.]

33.verse: And I knew him not; but he that sent me to baptize in water, said to me, On whom thou seest the Spirit coming down [Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit coming down], and dwelling on him, this is he, that baptizeth in the Holy Ghost.

34.verse: And I saw, and bare witnessing, that this is the Son of God.

35.verse: Another day John stood [Again John stood in another day], and two of his disciples;

36.verse: and he beheld Jesus walking, and saith [and he beholding Jesus walking, saith], Lo! the lamb of God.

37.verse: And two disciples heard him speaking, and [they] followed Jesus.

38.verse: And Jesus turned, and saw them following him, and saith to them, What seek ye? And they said to him, Rabbi, that is to say [that is interpreted], Master, where dwellest thou?

39.verse: And he saith to them, Come ye, and see. And they came, and saw where he dwelled [He saith to them, Come, and see ye. They came, and saw where he dwelt]; and dwelt with him that day. And it was as the tenth hour.

40.verse: And Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, was one of the twain, that heard of John, and had followed him.

41.verse: This found first his brother Simon, and he said to him, We have found Messias, that is to say, Christ; [This found first his brother Simon, and he saith to him, We have found Messias, that is interpreted Christ;]

42.verse: and he led him to Jesus. And Jesus beheld him, and said, Thou art Simon, the son of Jona; thou shalt be called Cephas, that is to say [that is interpreted], Peter.

43.verse: And on the morrow he would go out into Galilee, and he found Philip; and he saith to him [and Jesus saith to him], Follow thou me.

44.verse: Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and of Peter [the city of Andrew and Peter].

45.verse: Philip found Nathanael, and said to him [and he saith to him], We have found Jesus, the son of Joseph, of Nazareth, whom Moses wrote in the law and the prophets.

46.verse: And Nathanael said to him, Of Nazareth may some good thing be? Philip said to him [Philip saith to him], Come, and see.

47.verse: Jesus saw Nathanael coming to him, and said of him [and saith of him], Lo! verily a man of Israel, in whom is no guile.

48.verse: Nathanael said to him [Nathanael saith to him], Whereof hast thou known me? Jesus answered, and said to him, Before that Philip called thee, when thou were under the fig tree, I saw thee.

49.verse: Nathanael answered to him, and said [and saith], Rabbi, thou art the Son of God, thou art king of Israel.

50.verse: Jesus answered, and said to him, For I said to thee, I saw thee under the fig tree, thou believest; thou shalt see more than these things [thou shalt see more things than these].

51.verse: And he said to them, Truly, truly, I say to you, ye shall see heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending up and coming down on man's Son [and the angels of God ascending up and coming down upon man's Son].

1.verse: And the third day weddings were made in the Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there.

2.verse: And Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the weddings.

3.verse: And when wine failed, the mother of Jesus said to him, They have not wine.

4.verse: And Jesus saith to her, What to me and to thee, woman? mine hour came not yet.

5.verse: His mother saith to the ministers, Whatever thing he saith to you, do ye.

6.verse: And there were set six stone cans, after the cleansing of the Jews, holding each two or three metretes. [Forsooth there were put six stone pots, after the cleansing of Jews, taking each two or three measures.]

7.verse: And Jesus saith to them, Fill ye the pots with water. And they filled them, up to the mouth. [Jesus saith to them, Fill ye the pots with water. And they filled them unto the highest part.]

8.verse: And Jesus said to them, Draw ye now, and bear ye to the master of the feast . And they bare.

9.verse: And when the master of the feast had tasted the water made wine, and knew not whereof it was, but the ministers knew that drew the water , the master of the feast calleth the spouse,

10.verse: and saith to him, Each man setteth first good wine, and when men be filled, then that that is worse; but thou hast kept the good wine into this time. [and saith to him, Each man putteth first good wine, and when men shall be full-filled, then that that is worse; soothly thou hast kept good wine till now.]

11.verse: Jesus did this the beginning of signs in the Cana of Galilee, and showed his glory; and his disciples believed in him.

12.verse: After these things he came down to Capernaum, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples; and they dwelled there not many days [and they dwelt there not many days].

13.verse: And the pask of Jews was nigh, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

14.verse: And he found in the temple men selling oxen, and sheep, and culvers, and [money-]changers sitting.

15.verse: And when he had made as it were a scourge of small cords, he drove out all of the temple, and oxen, and sheep ; and he shedded [out] the money of changers, and turned upside-down the boards.

16.verse: And he said to them that sold culvers, Take away from hence these things, and do not ye make the house of my Father an house of merchandise.

17.verse: And his disciples had mind, for it was written, The fervent love of thine house hath eaten me [The zeal, or fervour of love, of thine house hath eaten me].

18.verse: Therefore the Jews answered, and said to him, What token showest thou to us [What sign, or token, showest thou to us], that thou doest these things?

19.verse: Jesus answered, and said to them, Undo ye this temple, and in three days I shall raise it.

20.verse: Therefore the Jews said to him, In forty and six years this temple was builded, and shalt thou in three days raise it [In forty and six years this temple is built, and thou in three days shalt raise it]?

21.verse: But he said of the temple of his body.

22.verse: Therefore when he was risen from death, his disciples had mind, that he said these things of his body [Therefore when he had risen from dead men, his disciples had mind, for he said this thing]; and they believed to the scripture, and to the word that Jesus said.

23.verse: And when Jesus was at Jerusalem in pask, in the feast day, many believed in his name, seeing his signs that he did [seeing the signs of him which he did].

24.verse: But Jesus trusted not himself to them, for he knew all men;

25.verse: and for it was not need to him, that any man should bear witnessing of man, for he knew, what was in man.

1.verse: And there was a man of the Pharisees, Nicodemus by name, a prince of the Jews.

2.verse: And he came to Jesus by night, and said to him, Rabbi, we know, that thou art come from God a master [Rabbi, we know, for of God thou hast come a master]; for no man may do these signs, that thou doest, but God be with him.

3.verse: Jesus answered, and said to him, Truly, truly, I say to thee, but a man be born again, he may not see the kingdom of God.

4.verse: Nicodemus said to him [Nicodemus saith to him], How may a man be born, when he is old? whether he may enter again into his mother's womb, and be born again?

5.verse: Jesus answered, Truly, truly, I say to thee, but a man be born again of water, and of the Holy Ghost, he may not enter into the kingdom of God.

6.verse: That that is born of the flesh, is flesh; and that that is born of the Spirit, is spirit.

7.verse: Wonder thou not, for I said to thee, It behooveth you to be born again.

8.verse: The Spirit breatheth where he will, and thou hearest his voice, but thou knowest not, from whence he cometh, nor whither he goeth; so is each man that is born of the Spirit.

9.verse: Nicodemus answered, and said to him, How may these things be done [How be these things able to be done]?

10.verse: Jesus answered, and said to him, Thou art a master in Israel, and knowest not these things? [Jesus answered, and said to him, Art thou a master in Israel, and knowest not these things?]

11.verse: Truly, truly, I say to thee, for we speak that that we know, and we witness that that we have seen, and ye take not our witnessing.

12.verse: If I have said to you earthly things, and ye believe not, how if I say to you heavenly things, shall ye believe?

13.verse: And no man ascendeth [up] into heaven, but he that came down from heaven, man's Son that is in heaven. [And no man ascendeth into heaven, no but he that came down from heaven, the Son of man which is in heaven.]

14.verse: And as Moses areared a serpent in desert [And as Moses reared up a serpent in desert], so it behooveth man's Son to be raised [up],

15.verse: that each man that believeth in him, perish not, but have everlasting life.

16.verse: For God loved so the world [Forsooth God so loved the world], that he gave his one begotten Son, that each man that believeth in him perish not, but have everlasting life.

17.verse: For God sent not his Son into the world, that he judge the world, but that the world be saved by him.

18.verse: He that believeth in him, is not deemed; but he that believeth not, is now deemed [He that believeth into him is not deemed, or condemned; forsooth he that believeth not, is now condemned], for he believeth not in the name of the one begotten Son of God.

19.verse: And this is the doom, for light came into the world, and men loved more darknesses than light; for their works were evil.

20.verse: For each man that doeth evil, hateth the light; and he cometh not to the light [and cometh not to the light], that his works be not reproved.

21.verse: But he that doeth truth, cometh to the light, that his works be showed, that they be done in God.

22.verse: After these things Jesus came, and his disciples, into the land of Judaea, and there he dwelled with them, and baptized [and baptized, or christened].

23.verse: And John was baptizing in Aenon, beside Salim, for many waters were there; and they came, and were baptized.

24.verse: And John was not yet sent into prison.

25.verse: Therefore a question was made of John's disciples with the Jews, of the purification [of the purification, or cleansing].

26.verse: And they came to John, and said to him, Master [Rabbi, or Master], he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom thou hast borne witnessing, lo! he baptizeth, and all men come to him.

27.verse: John answered, and said, A man may not take any thing, but it be given to him from heaven.

28.verse: Ye yourselves bear witnessing to me, that I said, I am not Christ, but that I am sent before him.

29.verse: He that hath a wife, is the husband ; but the friend of the spouse that standeth, and heareth him, joyeth with joy, for the voice of the spouse. Therefore in this thing my joy is fulfilled.

30.verse: It behooveth him to wax, but me to be made less. [It behooveth him to wax, forsooth me to be diminished, or made less.]

31.verse: He that came from above, is above all; he that is of the earth, speaketh of the earth; he that cometh from heaven, is above all.

32.verse: And he witnesseth that thing that he hath seen, and heard [And this thing that he saw and heard, he witnesseth], and no man taketh his witnessing.

33.verse: But he that taketh his witnessing, hath confirmed that God is soothfast. [Forsooth he that hath taken his witnessing, hath marked that God is soothfast.]

34.verse: But he whom God hath sent, speaketh the words of God; for not to measure God giveth the Spirit.

35.verse: The Father loveth the Son, and he hath given all things into his hand.

36.verse: He that believeth in the Son, hath everlasting life; but he that is unbelieveful to the Son, shall not see everlasting life, but the wrath of God dwelleth on him.

1.verse: Therefore as Jesus knew, that the Pharisees heard, that Jesus maketh and baptizeth more disciples than John,

2.verse: though Jesus baptized not, but his disciples,

3.verse: he left Judaea, and went again into Galilee.

4.verse: And it behooved him to pass by Samaria.

5.verse: Therefore Jesus came into a city of Samaria, that is called Sychar, beside the place [beside the manor, or field], that Jacob gave to Joseph, his son.

6.verse: And the well of Jacob was there; and Jesus was weary of the journey, and sat thus upon the well [soothly Jesus made weary of the journey, sat thus on the well]. And the hour was, as it were the sixth.

7.verse: And a woman came from Samaria, to draw water. And Jesus saith to her, Give me [to] drink.

8.verse: And his disciples were gone into the city, to buy meat.

9.verse: Therefore that woman of Samaria saith to him, How thou, that art a Jew, askest of me a drink, that am a woman of Samaria [which am a woman of Samaria]? for [the] Jews used not to deal with [the] Samaritans.

10.verse: Jesus answered, and said to her, If thou knewest the gift of God, and who it is, that saith to thee, Give me [to] drink, thou peradventure wouldest have asked of him, and he should have given to thee quick water.

11.verse: The woman saith to him, Sire, thou hast not wherein to draw [Sire, neither thou hast in what thing thou shalt draw], and the pit is deep; whereof then hast thou quick water?

12.verse: Whether thou art greater than our father Jacob, that gave to us the pit? and he drank thereof, and his sons, and his beasts.

13.verse: Jesus answered, and said to her, Each man that drinketh of this water, shall thirst again;

14.verse: but he that drinketh of the water that I shall give him, shall not thirst without end [shall not thirst into without end]; but the water that I shall give him, shall be made in him a well of water, springing up into everlasting life.

15.verse: The woman saith to him, Sire, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.

16.verse: Jesus saith to her, Go, call thine husband, and come hither.

17.verse: The woman answered, and said, I have none husband [I have not an husband]. Jesus saith to her, Thou saidest well, That I have none husband [For I have not an husband];

18.verse: for thou hast had five husbands, and he that thou hast, is not thine husband [and he whom thou hast now, is not thine husband]. This thing thou saidest soothly.

19.verse: The woman saith to him, Lord, I see, that thou art a prophet.

20.verse: Our fathers worshipped in this hill, and ye say, that at Jerusalem is a place, where it behooveth to worship.

21.verse: Jesus saith to her, Woman, believe thou to me, for the hour shall come, when neither in this hill, neither in Jerusalem [nor in Jerusalem], ye shall worship the Father.

22.verse: Ye worship that that ye know not; we worship that that we know; for health is of the Jews.

23.verse: But the time is come [But the hour cometh], and now it is, when true worshippers shall worship the Father in spirit and truth; for also the Father seeketh such, that worship him.

24.verse: God is a Spirit, and it behooveth them that worship him, to worship in spirit and truth.

25.verse: The woman saith to him, I know that Messias is come, that is said Christ; therefore when he cometh [therefore when he shall come], he shall tell us all things.

26.verse: Jesus saith to her, I am he, that speaketh with thee. [Jesus saith to her, I am, that speak with thee.]

27.verse: And at once [And anon] his disciples came, and wondered, that he spake with the woman; nevertheless no man said to him, What seekest thou, or, What speakest thou with her?

28.verse: Therefore the woman left her water pot, and went into the city, and said to the men [and saith to the men],

29.verse: Come ye, and see a man, that said to me all things that I have done; whether he be Christ? [Come ye, and see a man, that said to me all things what ever I have done; whether he is Christ?]

30.verse: And they went out of the city, and came to him.

31.verse: In the mean while his disciples prayed him, and said, Master, eat. [In the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Rabbi, or Master, eat.]

32.verse: But he said to them, I have meat to eat, that ye know not.

33.verse: Therefore the disciples said together, Whether any man hath brought him meat to eat [Whether any man brought to him to eat]?

34.verse: Jesus saith to them, My meat is, that I do the will of him that sent me, [and] that I perform the work of him.

35.verse: Whether ye say not, that yet four months be, and ripe corn cometh? Lo! I say to you, lift up your eyes, and see ye the fields, for now they be white to reap.

36.verse: And he that reapeth taketh hire, and gathereth fruit into everlasting life; that both he that soweth, and he that reapeth, have joy together.

37.verse: In this thing is the word true, For one is that soweth, and another that reapeth.

38.verse: I sent you to reap, that that ye have not travailed; other men have travailed, and ye have entered into their travails.

39.verse: And of that city many [of the] Samaritans believed in him, for the word of the woman, that bare witnessing, That he said to me all things that I have done [For he said to me all things, whatever I did].

40.verse: Therefore when Samaritans came to him, they prayed him to dwell there [they prayed him, that he should dwell there]; and he dwelt there two days.

41.verse: And many more believed for his word,

42.verse: and said to the woman, That now not for thy speech we believe; for we have heard, and we know, that this is verily the Saviour of the world.

43.verse: And after two days he went out from thence [Forsooth after two days he went thence], and went into Galilee.

44.verse: And he [Jesus] bare witnessing, that a prophet in his own country hath none honour. [Soothly he Jesus bare witnessing, for a prophet in his own country hath not honour, or worship.]

45.verse: Therefore when he came into Galilee, men of Galilee received him, when they had seen all things that he had done in Jerusalem in the feast day; for also they had come to the feast day.

46.verse: Therefore he came again into the Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a little king, whose son was sick at Capernaum. [Therefore he came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And some little king was, whose son was sick at Capernaum.]

47.verse: When this had heard, that Jesus should come from Judaea into Galilee, he went to him, and prayed him, that he should come down, and heal his son; for he began to die.

48.verse: Therefore Jesus said to him, But ye see tokens and great wonders, ye believe not.

49.verse: The little king saith to him, Lord, come down, before that my son die.

50.verse: Jesus saith to him, Go, thy son liveth. The man believed to the word, that Jesus said to him, and he went.

51.verse: And now when he came down [Soothly now him coming down], the servants came to meet him, and told to him, and said [saying], That his son lived.

52.verse: And he asked of them the hour, in which he was amended. And they said to him, For yesterday in the seventh hour the fever left him.

53.verse: Therefore the father knew, that that hour it was, in which Jesus said to him, Thy son liveth; and he believed, and all his house.

54.verse: Jesus did again this second token, when he came from Judaea into Galilee.

1.verse: After these things there was a feast day of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.

2.verse: And in Jerusalem is a washing place, that in Hebrew is called Bethesda, and hath five porches. [Forsooth at Jerusalem is a standing water of beasts, that in Hebrew is called Bethesda, having five little gates, or entries.]

3.verse: In these lay a great multitude of sick men, blind, crooked, and dry, abiding the moving of the water.

4.verse: For the angel of the Lord came down certain times into the [standing] water, and the water was moved; and he that first came down into the cistern, after the moving of the water, was made whole of whatever sickness he was held [was made whole of whatever sickness he was holden with].

5.verse: And a man was there [Forsooth some man was there], having eight and thirty years in his sickness.

6.verse: And when Jesus had seen him lying, and had known, that he had much time [and had known, for now he had much time], he saith to him, Wilt thou be made whole?

7.verse: The sick man answered to him, Lord, I have no man, that when the water is moved [that when the water is troubled], to put me into the cistern; for while I come, another goeth down before me.

8.verse: Jesus saith to him, Rise up, take thy bed, and go. [Jesus saith to him, Rise up, take thy bed, and wander.]

9.verse: And at once the man was made whole, and took up his bed, and went forth [And anon the man is made whole, and took up his bed, and wandered]. And it was sabbath in that day.

10.verse: Therefore the Jews said to him that was made whole, It is sabbath, it is not leaveful to thee, to take away thy bed.

11.verse: He answered to them, He that made me whole, said to me, Take thy bed, and go [Take thy bed, and wander].

12.verse: Therefore they asked him, What man is that, that said to thee, Take up thy bed, and go? [Therefore they asked him, Who is that man, that said to thee, Take thy bed and wander?]

13.verse: But he that was made whole, wist not who it was. And Jesus bowed away from the people, that was set in the place [Forsooth Jesus bowed him from the company ordained, or set, in the place].

14.verse: Afterward Jesus found him in the temple, and said to him, Lo! thou art made whole; now do not thou do sin [now do not thou sin], lest any worse thing befall to thee.

15.verse: That man went, and told to the Jews, that it was Jesus that made him whole.

16.verse: Therefore the Jews pursued Jesus, for he did this thing in the sabbath.

17.verse: And Jesus answered to them, My Father worketh till now, and I work.

18.verse: Therefore the Jews sought more to slay him, for not only he brake the sabbath, but [and] he said that God was his Father, and made him(self) even to God [making him even to God].

19.verse: Therefore Jesus answered, and said to them, Truly, truly, I say to you, the Son may not of himself do any thing, but that thing that he seeth the Father doing; for whatever things he doeth, the Son doeth in like manner those things [whatever things soothly he doeth, these things and the Son also doeth].

20.verse: For the Father loveth the Son, and showeth to him all things that he doeth; and he shall show to him greater works than these, that ye wonder.

21.verse: For as the Father raiseth dead men, and quickeneth, [and] so the Son quickeneth whom he will.

22.verse: For neither the Father judgeth any man, but hath given every doom to the Son [but hath given all the doom to the Son],

23.verse: that all men honour the Son, as they honour the Father. He that honoureth not the Son, honoureth not the Father that sent him.

24.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, that he that heareth my word, and believeth in him that sent me, hath everlasting life, and he cometh not into doom, but passeth from death into life [hath everlasting life, and cometh not into doom, but passed from death into life].

25.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, for the hour cometh, and now it is, when dead men shall hear the voice of the Son of God, and they that hear, shall live.

26.verse: For as the Father hath life in himself, so he gave to the Son, to have life in himself;

27.verse: and he gave to him power to make doom, for he is man's Son.

28.verse: Do not ye wonder in this, for the hour cometh, in which all men that be in burials, shall hear the voice of God's Son.

29.verse: And they that have done good things, shall go into again-rising of life; but they that have done evil things, into again-rising of doom. [And they that have done good things, shall come forth into rising again of life; forsooth they that have done evil things, into rising again of doom.]

30.verse: I may nothing do of myself, but as I hear, I deem [I may not of myself do any thing, but as I hear, I judge], and my doom is just, for I seek not my will, but the will of the Father that sent me.

31.verse: If I bear witnessing of myself, my witnessing is not true;

32.verse: another is that beareth witnessing of me, and I know that his witnessing is true, that he beareth of me.

33.verse: Ye sent to John, and he bare witnessing to [the] truth.

34.verse: But I take not witnessing of man; but I say these things, that ye be safe.

35.verse: He was a lantern burning and shining [He was a lantern burning and shining, or giving light]; but ye would glad, or joy, at an hour in his light.

36.verse: But I have more witnessing than John, for the works that my Father gave to me to perform them [forsooth the works that my Father gave me that I perform them], those works that I do bear witnessing of me, that the Father sent me.

37.verse: And the Father that sent me, he bare witnessing of me. Neither ye heard ever his voice, neither ye saw his likeness [neither saw his likeness, or form].

38.verse: And ye have not his word dwelling in you; for ye believe not to him, whom he sent.

39.verse: Seek ye the scriptures, in which ye guess [in which ye ween] to have everlasting life; and those it be, that bear witnessing of me.

40.verse: And ye will not come to me, that ye have life.

41.verse: I take not clearness of men;

42.verse: but I have known you, that ye have not the love of God in you.

43.verse: I came in the name of my Father, and ye took not me. If another [shall] come in his own name, ye shall receive him.

44.verse: How be ye able to believe [How may ye believe], that receive glory each of (the) other, and ye seek not the glory that is of God alone?

45.verse: Do not ye guess, that I am to accuse you with the Father; it is Moses that accuseth you, in whom ye hope.

46.verse: For if ye believed to Moses, peradventure ye should believe also to me; for he wrote of me.

47.verse: But if ye believe not to his letters, how shall ye believe to my words?

1.verse: After these things Jesus went over the sea of Galilee, that is Tiberias.

2.verse: And a great multitude followed him; for they saw the tokens, that he did on them that were sick.

3.verse: Therefore Jesus went into an hill, and sat there with his disciples [and there he sat with his disciples].

4.verse: And the pask was full nigh, a feast day of the Jews.

5.verse: Therefore when Jesus had lifted up his eyes, and had seen, that a great multitude came to him, he saith to Philip, Whereof shall we buy loaves, that these men eat?

6.verse: But he said this thing, tempting him; for he knew what he was to do.

7.verse: Philip answered to him, The loaves of two hundred pence suffice not to them, that each man take a little what.

8.verse: One of his disciples, Andrew, the brother of Simon Peter, saith to him,

9.verse: A child is here, that hath five barley loaves and two fishes; but what be these among so many?

10.verse: Therefore Jesus saith, Make them sit to the meat [Make ye men to sit at the meat]. And there was much hay in the place. And so men sat to the meat, as five thousand in number [Therefore men sat at the meat, in number as five thousand].

11.verse: And Jesus took [the] five loaves, and when he had done thankings, he parted to the men that sat to the meat [he parted to men sitting at the meat], and also of the fishes, as much as they would.

12.verse: And when they were filled, he said to his disciples, Gather ye the remnants that be left [Gather ye the reliefs that be left], that they perish not.

13.verse: And so they gathered, and filled twelve baskets of the remnant of the five barley loaves and two fishes [Therefore they gathered, and filled twelve coffins of reliefs of the five barley loaves and two fishes], that left to them that had eaten.

14.verse: Therefore those men, when they had seen the sign [when they had seen the token, or miracle,] that he had done, said, For this is verily the prophet, that is to come into the world.

15.verse: And when Jesus had known, that they were to come to take him, and make him king, he flew alone again into an hill.

16.verse: And when eventide was come [Soothly as even was made], his disciples went down to the sea.

17.verse: And they went up into a boat, and they came over the sea into Capernaum. And darknesses were made then, and Jesus was not come to them [And darknesses were now made, and Jesus had not come to them].

18.verse: And for a great wind blew, the sea rose up.

19.verse: Therefore when they had rowed as five and twenty furlongs or thirty, they see Jesus walking on the sea/they saw Jesus walking on the sea, and to be nigh the boat; and they dreaded.

20.verse: And he said to them, I am; do not ye dread.

21.verse: Therefore they would take him into the boat, and at once [and anon] the boat was at the land, to which they went.

22.verse: On the tother day the people, that stood over the sea, saw, that there was none other boat there but that one, and that Jesus entered not with his disciples into the boat, but his disciples alone went [but his disciples went alone].

23.verse: But other boats came from Tiberias beside the place, where they had eaten bread [where they ate bread], and did thankings to God.

24.verse: Therefore when the people had seen, that Jesus was not there, neither his disciples, they went up into boats, and came to Capernaum, seeking Jesus.

25.verse: And when they had found him over the sea, they said to him, Rabbi, how camest thou hither?

26.verse: Jesus answered to them, and said, Truly, truly, I say to you, ye seek me, not for ye saw the miracles, but for ye ate of the loaves, and were filled.

27.verse: Work ye not (for) meat that perisheth, but that that dwelleth into everlasting life, which meat man's Son shall give to you; for God the Father hath marked him.

28.verse: Therefore they said to him, What shall we do, that we work the works of God?

29.verse: Jesus answered, and said to them, This is the work of God, that ye believe to him, whom he sent.

30.verse: Therefore they said to him, What token then doest thou, that we see, and believe to thee? what workest thou?

31.verse: Our fathers ate manna in desert, as it is written, He gave to them bread from heaven to eat.

32.verse: Therefore Jesus saith to them, Truly, truly, I say to you, Moses gave you not bread from heaven, but my Father giveth you very bread from heaven;

33.verse: for it is very bread that cometh down from heaven, and giveth life to the world.

34.verse: Therefore they said to him, Lord, ever give us this bread. [Therefore they said to him, Lord, evermore give to us this bread.]

35.verse: And Jesus said to them, I am bread of life; he that cometh to me, shall not hunger; and he that believeth in me, shall never thirst.

36.verse: But I said to you, that ye have seen me, and ye believe not. [But I said to you, for and ye have seen me, and believed not.]

37.verse: All thing, that the Father giveth to me, shall come to me; and I shall not cast him out [and I shall not cast out him], that cometh to me.

38.verse: For I came down from heaven, not that I do my will, but the will of him that sent me.

39.verse: And this is the will of the Father that sent me, that all thing that the Father gave to me, I lose not of it [I lose nought of it], but again-raise it in the last day.

40.verse: And this is the will of my Father that sent me, that each man that seeth the Son, and believeth in him, have everlasting life; and I shall again-raise him in the last day.

41.verse: Therefore the Jews grumbled of him, for he had said [Therefore Jews grutched of him, for he said], I am bread that came down from heaven.

42.verse: And they said, Whether this is not Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we have known. How then saith he this, That I came down from heaven [Therefore how saith he this, I came down from heaven]?

43.verse: Therefore Jesus answered, and said to them, Do not ye grumble together [Do not ye grutch together].

44.verse: No man may come to me, but if the Father that sent me, draw him [no but the Father that sent me, draw him]; and I shall again-raise him in the last day.

45.verse: It is written in the prophets, And all men shall be able to be taught of God. Each man that hath heard of the Father, and hath learned, cometh to me.

46.verse: Not for any man hath seen the Father, but this that is of God, hath seen the Father.

47.verse: Soothly, soothly, I say to you, he that believeth in me, hath everlasting life.

48.verse: I am [the] bread of life. [I am the bread of life.]

49.verse: Your fathers ate manna in desert, and be dead.

50.verse: This is bread coming down from heaven, that if any man [shall] eat thereof, he die not.

51.verse: I am living bread, that came down from heaven. If any man eat of this bread, he shall live without end. And the bread that I shall give, is my flesh for the life of the world.

52.verse: Therefore the Jews chided together, and said [saying], How may this give to us his flesh to eat?

53.verse: Therefore Jesus saith to them, Truly, truly, I say to you, but ye eat the flesh of man's Son, and drink his blood, ye shall not have life in you.

54.verse: He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, hath everlasting life, and I shall again-raise him in the last day.

55.verse: For my flesh is very meat, and my blood is very drink.

56.verse: He that eateth my flesh, and drinketh my blood, dwelleth in me, and I in him.

57.verse: As my Father living sent me, and I live for the Father, and he that eateth me, he shall live for me.

58.verse: This is bread, that came down from heaven. Not as your fathers ate manna, and be dead; he that eateth this bread, shall live without end.

59.verse: He said these things in the synagogue, teaching in Capernaum.

60.verse: Therefore many of his disciples hearing [this], said, This word is hard, who may hear it?

61.verse: But Jesus witting at himself, that his disciples grumbled of this thing [Forsooth Jesus witting with himself, for his disciples grutched of this thing], said to them, This thing offendeth you?

62.verse: Therefore if ye [shall] see man's Son ascending [up], where he was before?

63.verse: It is the spirit that quickeneth, the flesh profiteth nothing; the words that I have spoken to you, be spirit and life.

64.verse: verse doesn't exist in this bible version

65.verse: And he said, Therefore I said to you, that no man may come to me, but it were given to him of my Father.

66.verse: From this time many of his disciples went aback, and went not now with him.

67.verse: Therefore Jesus said to the twelve, Whether ye will also go away?

68.verse: And Simon Peter answered to him, Lord, to whom shall we go? Thou hast words of everlasting life;

69.verse: and we believe, and have known [and we have believed, and know], that thou art Christ, the Son of God.

70.verse: Therefore Jesus answered to them, Whether I chose not you twelve, and one of you is a fiend [and one of you is a devil]?

71.verse: And he said this of Judas of Simon Iscariot, for this was to betray him, when he was one of the twelve.

1.verse: After these things Jesus walked into Galilee, for he would not walk into Judaea, for the Jews sought to slay him.

2.verse: And there was nigh a feast day of the Jews, [a feast of] Tabernacles.

3.verse: And his brethren said to him, Pass from hence [Pass hence], and go into Judaea, that also thy disciples see thy works that thou doest;

4.verse: for no man doeth any thing in huddles, and himself seeketh to be open . If thou doest these things, show thyself to the world.

5.verse: For neither his brethren believed in him.

6.verse: Therefore Jesus saith to them, My time came not yet, but your time is evermore ready.

7.verse: The world may not hate you, soothly it hateth me; for I bear witnessing thereof, that the works of it be evil.

8.verse: Go ye up to this feast day, but I shall not go up to this feast day, for my time is not yet fulfilled [full-filled].

9.verse: When he had said these things, he dwelt in Galilee.

10.verse: And after that his brethren were gone up, then [and] he went up to the feast day, not openly, but as in private.

11.verse: Therefore the Jews sought him in the feast day, and said, Where is he?

12.verse: And much grumbling [And much grutching] was of him among the people. For some said, That he is good; and others said, Nay, but he deceiveth the people;

13.verse: nevertheless no man spake openly of him, for dread of the Jews.

14.verse: But when the middle feast day came, Jesus went up into the temple, and taught.

15.verse: And the Jews wondered, and said [saying], How knoweth this man letters, since he hath not learned?

16.verse: Jesus answered to them, and said, My doctrine is not mine, but his that sent me.

17.verse: If any man will do his will, he shall know of the teaching, whether it be of God, or [whether] I speak of myself.

18.verse: He that speaketh of himself, seeketh his own glory; but he that seeketh the glory of him that sent him, is soothfast, and unrightwiseness is not in him.

19.verse: Whether Moses gave not to you a law, and none of you doeth the law [and no man of you keepeth the law]? What seek ye to slay me?

20.verse: And the people answered, and said, Thou hast a devil; who seeketh to slay thee?

21.verse: Jesus answered, and said to them, I have done one work, and all ye wonder.

22.verse: Therefore Moses gave to you circumcision; not for it is of Moses, but of the fathers; and in the sabbath ye circumcise a man.

23.verse: If a man take circumcision in the sabbath, that the law of Moses be not broken, have ye indignation to me, for I made all a man whole in the sabbath [have ye indignation, or wrath, to me, for I made all the man whole in the sabbath]?

24.verse: Do not ye deem after the face, but deem ye a rightful doom [but deem a rightful doom].

25.verse: Therefore some of Jerusalem said, Whether this is not he, whom the Jews seek to slay?

26.verse: and lo! he speaketh openly, and they say nothing to him. Whether the princes know verily, that this is Christ?

27.verse: But we know this man, of whence he is; but when Christ shall come, no man knoweth of whence he is.

28.verse: Therefore Jesus cried in the temple teaching, and said [Therefore Jesus cried in the temple, teaching, and saying], Ye know me, and ye know of whence I am; and I came not of myself, but he is true that sent me, whom ye know not.

29.verse: I know him, and if I say that I know him not, I shall be like to you, a liar; but I know him, for of him I am, and he sent me.

30.verse: Therefore they sought to take him, and no man set on him hands, for his hour came not yet.

31.verse: And many of the people believed in him, and said, When Christ shall come, whether he shall do more tokens, than those that this doeth?

32.verse: The Pharisees heard the people musing of him [grutching of him] these things; and the princes and the Pharisees sent ministers, to take him.

33.verse: Therefore Jesus said to them, Yet a little time I am with you, and I go to the Father, that sent me.

34.verse: Ye shall seek me, and ye shall not find me; and where I am, ye be not able to come [and where I am, ye may not come].

35.verse: Therefore the Jews said to themselves, Whither shall this go, for we shall not find him? whether he will go into the scattering of heathen men, and will teach the heathen?

36.verse: What is this word, which he said, Ye shall seek me, and ye shall not find me; and where I am, ye be not able to come? [What is this word, that he said, Ye shall seek me, and ye shall not find; and where I am, ye may not come?]

37.verse: But in the last day of the great feast, Jesus stood, and cried, and said [saying], If any man thirsteth, come he to me, and drink.

38.verse: He that believeth in me, as the scripture saith, Rivers of quick water shall flow out of his womb [Floods of quick water shall flow of his womb].

39.verse: But he said this thing of the Spirit [Soothly he said this thing of the Holy Ghost], which men that believed in him should take; for the Spirit was not yet given, for Jesus was not yet glorified.

40.verse: Therefore of that company, when they had heard these words of him, they said, This is verily a prophet.

41.verse: Others said, This is Christ. But some said, Whether Christ cometh from Galilee?

42.verse: Whether the scripture saith not, that of the seed of David, and of the castle of Bethlehem, where David was, Christ cometh?

43.verse: Therefore dissension was made among the people for him. [And so dissension is made in the company for him.]

44.verse: And some of them would have taken him, but no man set hands on him.

45.verse: Therefore the ministers came to the bishops and Pharisees, and they said to them, Why brought ye not him?

46.verse: The ministers answered, Never man spake so, as this man speaketh.

47.verse: Therefore the Pharisees answered to them, Whether ye be deceived also?

48.verse: whether any of the princes or of the Pharisees believed in him?

49.verse: But this people, that knoweth not the law, be cursed.

50.verse: Nicodemus saith to them, he that came to him by night, that was one of them,

51.verse: Whether our law deemeth a man, but it have first heard of him [no but first it hear of him], and know what he doeth?

52.verse: They answered, and said to him, Whether thou art a man of Galilee also [Whether and thou art a man of Galilee]? Seek thou scriptures, and see thou, that a prophet riseth not of Galilee [for a prophet riseth not of Galilee].

53.verse: And they turned again, each into his house.

1.verse: But Jesus went into the mount of Olives.

2.verse: And early again he came into the temple; and all the people came to him; and he sat, and taught them.

3.verse: And scribes and Pharisees brought a woman taken in adultery, and they setted her in the middle [and set her in the middle],

4.verse: and said to him, Master, this woman is now taken in adultery.

5.verse: And in the law Moses commanded us to stone such; therefore what sayest thou?

6.verse: And they said this thing tempting him, that they might accuse him. And Jesus bowed himself down, and wrote with his finger in the earth.

7.verse: And when they abided asking him [Soothly when they lasted, or continued, asking him], he raised himself, and said to them, He of you that is without sin, first cast a stone into her.

8.verse: And again he bowed [down] himself, and wrote in the earth.

9.verse: And they hearing these things, went away one after another, and they began from the elder men [Soothly they hearing these things, went away one after another, they beginning at the elder men]; and Jesus dwelt alone, and the woman standing in the middle.

10.verse: And Jesus raised himself, and said to her, Woman, where be they that accused thee? no man hath condemned thee.

11.verse: She said, No man, Lord. Jesus said to her, Neither I shall condemn thee; go thou, and now after do not thou sin no more .

12.verse: Therefore again Jesus spake to them, and said [saying], I am the light of the world; he that followeth me, walketh not in darknesses, but shall have the light of life.

13.verse: Therefore the Pharisees said, Thou bearest witnessing of thyself; thy witnessing is not true.

14.verse: Jesus answered, and said to them, And if I bear witnessing of myself, my witnessing is true; for I know from whence I came, and whither I go. But ye know not from whence I came, nor whither I go.

15.verse: For ye deem after the flesh, but I deem no man; [Forsooth ye deem after the flesh, I deem not any man;]

16.verse: and if I deem, my doom is true, for I am not alone, but I and the Father that sent me.

17.verse: And in your law it is written, that the witnessing of two men is true.

18.verse: I am, that bear witnessing of myself, and the Father that sent me, beareth witnessing of me.

19.verse: Therefore they said to him, Where is thy Father? Jesus answered, Neither ye know me, nor ye know my Father; if ye knew me, peradventure ye should know also my Father.

20.verse: Jesus spake these words in the treasury, teaching in the temple; and no man took him, for his hour came not yet.

21.verse: Therefore again Jesus said to them, Lo! I go, and ye shall seek me, and ye shall die in your sin; whither I go, ye be not able to come [whither I go, ye may not come].

22.verse: Therefore the Jews said, Whether he shall slay himself, for he saith, Whither I go, ye be not able to come [Whither I go, ye may come]?

23.verse: And he said to them, Ye be of beneath, I am of above; ye be of this world, I am not of this world.

24.verse: Therefore I said to you, that ye shall die in your sins; for if ye believe not that I am, ye shall die in your sins.

25.verse: Therefore they said to him, Who art thou? Jesus said to them, The beginning, which also speak to you [Jesus said to them, The beginning, or the first of all thing, the which and I speak to you].

26.verse: I have many things to speak, and to deem of you, but he that sent me is soothfast; and I speak in the world these things, that I heard of him.

27.verse: And they knew not, that he called his Father God. [And they knew not, for he said his Father God.]

28.verse: Therefore Jesus said to them, When ye have araised man's Son, then ye shall know, that I am, and of myself I do nothing; but as my Father taught me, I speak these things.

29.verse: And he that sent me is with me, and left me not alone; for I do evermore those things, that be pleasing to him. [And he that sent me is with me, and left not me alone; for I do ever those things, that be pleasant to him.]

30.verse: When he spake these things, many believed in him.

31.verse: Therefore Jesus said to the Jews, that believed in him, If ye dwell in my word, verily ye shall be my disciples;

32.verse: and ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free.

33.verse: Therefore the Jews answered to him, We be the seed of Abraham, and we served never to [no] man; how sayest thou, That ye shall be free [how sayest thou, Ye shall be free]?

34.verse: Jesus answered to them, Truly, truly, I say to you, each man that doeth sin, is [the] servant of sin.

35.verse: And the servant dwelleth not in the house without end [into without end], but the Son dwelleth without end [into without end].

36.verse: Therefore if the Son [shall] make you free, verily ye shall be free.

37.verse: I know that ye be Abraham's sons, but ye seek to slay me, for my word taketh not in you.

38.verse: I speak those things, that I saw at my Father; and ye do those things, that ye saw at your father.

39.verse: They answered, and said to him, Abraham is our father. Jesus saith to them, If ye be the sons of Abraham, do ye the works of Abraham.

40.verse: But now ye seek to slay me, a man that have spoken to you [the] truth, that I heard of God; Abraham did not this thing.

41.verse: Ye do the works of your father. Therefore they said to him [And so they said to him], We be not born of fornication; we have one Father, God.

42.verse: But Jesus saith to them, If God were your Father, soothly ye should love me; for I passed forth of God, and came [forsooth I proceeded, or went forth, of God, and came]; for neither I came of myself, but he sent me.

43.verse: Why know ye not my speech? for ye be not able to hear my word.

44.verse: Ye be of the father, the devil, and ye will do the desires of your father. He was a manslayer from the beginning, and he stood not in truth; for truth is not in him. When he speaketh lying [When he speaketh a lying], he speaketh of his own; for he is a liar, and father of it.

45.verse: But for I say truth, ye believe not to me.

46.verse: Who of you shall reprove me of sin? if I say truth, why believe ye not to me?

47.verse: He that is of God, heareth the words of God; therefore ye hear not, for ye be not of God.

48.verse: Therefore the Jews answered, and said [to him], Whether we say not well, that thou art a Samaritan, and hast a devil?

49.verse: Jesus answered, and said, I have not a devil, but I honour my Father, and ye have unhonoured me.

50.verse: For I seek not my glory; there is he, that seeketh, and deemeth.

51.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, if any man keep my word, he shall not taste death without end. [Truly, truly, I say to you, if any man shall keep my word, he shall not see, or taste, death into without end.]

52.verse: Therefore the Jews said, Now we have known, that thou hast a devil. Abraham is dead, and the prophets, and thou sayest, If any man keep my word, he shall not taste death without end [he shall not taste death into without end].

53.verse: Whether thou art greater than our father Abraham, that is dead, and the prophets be dead; whom makest thou thyself?

54.verse: Jesus answered, If I glorify myself, my glory is nought; my Father is, that glorifieth me, whom ye say, that he is your God.

55.verse: And ye have not known him, but I have known him; and if I [shall] say that I know him not, I shall be a liar like to you; but I know him, and I keep his word.

56.verse: Abraham, your father, gladded to see my day [Abraham, your father, gladded, or full out joyed, that he should see my day]; and he saw, and joyed.

57.verse: Then the Jews said to him, Thou hast not yet fifty years, and hast thou seen Abraham?

58.verse: Therefore Jesus said to them, Truly, truly I say to you, before that Abraham should be, I am. [Therefore Jesus said to them, Truly, truly, I say to you, before that Abraham was made, I am.]

59.verse: Therefore they took stones, to cast to him; but Jesus hid him(self), and went out of the temple.

1.verse: And Jesus passing, saw a man blind from the birth.

2.verse: And his disciples asked him, Master, who sinned, this man, or his elders [And his disciples asked him, Rabbi, that is, Master, who sinned, this man, or his father and mother], that he should be born blind?

3.verse: Jesus answered, Neither this man sinned, neither his elders [neither his father and mother]; but that the works of God be showed in him.

4.verse: It behooveth me to work the works of him that sent me, as long as the day is [the while the day is]; the night shall come, when no man may work.

5.verse: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

6.verse: When he had said these things, he spat into the earth, and made clay of the spittle, and anointed the clay on his eyes,

7.verse: and said to him, Go, and be thou washed in the water of Siloam, that is to say, Sent. Then he went, and washed, and came seeing. [and said to him, Go, and be thou washen in the water, or cistern, of Siloam, that is interpreted, Sent. Therefore he went, and washed, and came seeing.]

8.verse: And so neighbours, and they that had seen him before, for he was a beggar, said, Whether this is not he, that sat, and begged?

9.verse: Other men said, That this it is; and other men said, Nay, but he is like him. But he said, I am [he].

10.verse: Therefore they said to him, How be thine eyes opened?

11.verse: He answered, That man, that is said Jesus, made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said to me, Go thou to the water of Siloam, and wash [Go thou to the water, or cistern, of Siloam, and wash]; and I went, and washed, and saw.

12.verse: And they said to him, Where is he? He said, I know not.

13.verse: They led him that was blind to the Pharisees.

14.verse: And it was sabbath, when Jesus made clay, and opened his eyes.

15.verse: Again the Pharisees asked him, how he had seen. And he said to them, He laid to me clay on the eyes [He put to me clay on the eyes]; and I washed, and I see.

16.verse: Therefore some of the Pharisees said, This man is not of God, that keepeth not the sabbath. Other men said, How may a sinful man do these signs. And strife was among them. [Therefore some of the Pharisees said, This man is not of God, for he keepeth not the sabbath. Other men said, How may a man sinner do these signs, or miracles? And division was among them.]

17.verse: Therefore they said again to the blind man [Therefore they say again to the blind man], What sayest thou of him, that opened thine eyes? And he said, That he is a prophet.

18.verse: Therefore the Jews believed not of him, that he was blind, and had seen, till they called his father and mother, that had seen.

19.verse: And they asked them, and said, Is this your son, which ye say was born blind [And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, whom ye say, for he is born blind]? how then seeth he now?

20.verse: His father and mother answered to them, and said, We know, that this is our son, and that he was born blind;

21.verse: but how he seeth now, we know not, or who opened his eyes, we know not; ask ye him, he hath age, speak he of himself.

22.verse: His father and mother said these things, for they dreaded the Jews; for then the Jews had conspired [forsooth now the Jews had conspired], that if any man acknowledged him Christ, he should be done out of the synagogue.

23.verse: Therefore his father and mother said, That he hath age, ask ye him.

24.verse: Therefore again they called the man, that was blind, and said to him, Give thou glory to God; we know, that this man is a sinner.

25.verse: Then he said, If he is a sinner, I know not; one thing I know, that when I was blind, now I see.

26.verse: Therefore they said to him, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?

27.verse: He answered to them, I said to you now, and ye heard; what will ye again hear? whether [and] ye will be made his disciples?

28.verse: Therefore they cursed him, and said, Be thou his disciple; we be [the] disciples of Moses.

29.verse: We know, that God spake to Moses; but we know not this, of whence he is.

30.verse: That man answered, and said to them, For in this is a wonderful thing, that ye know not, of whence he is, and he hath opened mine eyes.

31.verse: And we know, that God heareth not sinful men, but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, he heareth him. [Soothly we know, for God heareth not sinners, but if any man is worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.]

32.verse: From the world it is not heard, that any man opened the eyes of a blind-born man;

33.verse: but this man were of God, he might not do any thing.

34.verse: They answered, and said to him, Thou art all born in sins, and teachest thou us? And they put him out. [They answered, and said to him, Thou art all born in sins, and thou teachest us? And they cast him out.]

35.verse: Jesus heard, that they had put him out [Jesus heard, for they had cast him out]; and when he had found him, he said to him, Believest thou in the Son of God?

36.verse: He answered, and said, Lord, who is he, that I believe in him?

37.verse: And Jesus said to him, And thou hast seen him, and he it is, that speaketh with thee.

38.verse: And he said, Lord, I believe. And he fell down, and worshipped him.

39.verse: Therefore Jesus said to him, I came into this world, into doom, that they that see not, see, and they that see, be made blind.

40.verse: And some of the Pharisees heard, that were with him, and they said to him, Whether [and] we be blind?

41.verse: Jesus said to them, If ye were blind, ye should not have sin; but now ye say, That we see, your sin dwelleth still [your sin dwelleth].

1.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, he that cometh not in by the door into the fold of sheep, but ascendeth [up] by another way, is a night thief and a day thief.

2.verse: But he that entereth by the door, is the shepherd of the sheep.

3.verse: To this the porter openeth, and the sheep hear his voice, and he calleth his own sheep by name, and leadeth them out.

4.verse: And when he hath done out his own sheep [And when he hath sent out his own sheep], he goeth before them, and the sheep follow him; for they know his voice.

5.verse: But they follow not an alien, but flee from him; for they have not known the voice of aliens.

6.verse: Jesus said to them this proverb; but they knew not what he spake to them.

7.verse: Therefore Jesus said to them again, Truly, truly, I say to you, I am the door of the sheep.

8.verse: As many as have come, were night thieves and day thieves, but the sheep heard not them. [All how many ever came before me, be night thieves and day thieves, but the sheep heard not them.]

9.verse: I am the door. If any man shall enter by me, he shall be saved; and he shall go in, and shall go out, and he shall find pastures.

10.verse: A night thief cometh not, but that he steal, slay, and destroy; and I came, that they have life, and have more plenteously. [A night thief cometh not, but that he steal, and slay, and lose; I came, that they have life, and have more plenteously.]

11.verse: I am a good shepherd; a good shepherd giveth his life for his sheep.

12.verse: But an hired hind, and that is not the shepherd, whose be not the sheep his own [whose the sheep be not his own], seeth a wolf coming, and he leaveth the sheep, and fleeth; and the wolf snatcheth, and scattereth the sheep.

13.verse: And the hired hind fleeth, for he is an hired hind, and it pertaineth not to him of the sheep.

14.verse: I am a good shepherd, and I know my sheep, and my sheep know me.

15.verse: As the Father hath known me, I know the Father; and I put my life for my sheep.

16.verse: [And] I have other sheep, that be not of this fold, and it behooveth me to bring them together, and they shall hear my voice; and there shall be made one fold and one shepherd.

17.verse: Therefore the Father loveth me, for I put my life, that again I take it.

18.verse: No man taketh it from me, but I put it of myself. I have power to put it, and I have power to take it again. This commandment I have taken of my Father.

19.verse: Again dissension was made among the Jews for these words.

20.verse: And many of them said, He hath a devil, and maddeth [He hath a devil, and maddeth, or waxeth mad]; what hear ye him?

21.verse: Other men said, These words be not of a man that hath a devil. Whether the devil may open the eyes of blind men [Whether a devil may open the eyes of blind men]?

22.verse: But the feasts of hallowing of the temple were made in Jerusalem, and it was winter.

23.verse: And Jesus walked in the temple, in the porch of Solomon.

24.verse: Therefore the Jews came about him, and said to him, How long takest thou away our soul? if thou art Christ, say thou to us openly [and said to him, How long dost thou away our soul? if thou art Christ, say to us plainly, or openly].

25.verse: Jesus answered to them, I speak to you, and ye believe not; the works that I do in the name of my Father, bear witnessing of me [the works that I do in the name of my Father, these bear witness of me].

26.verse: But ye believe not, for ye be not of my sheep.

27.verse: My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.

28.verse: And I give to them everlasting life, and they shall not perish without end, and none shall snatch them out of mine hand. [And I shall give to them everlasting life, and they shall not perish into without end, and any man shall not snatch them out of mine hand.]

29.verse: That thing that my Father gave to me, is more than all things [That thing that my Father gave to me, is more than all]; and no man may snatch from my Father's hand.

30.verse: I and the Father be one.

31.verse: The Jews took up stones, to stone him.

32.verse: Jesus answered to them, I have showed to you many good works of my Father, for which work of them stone ye me?

33.verse: The Jews answered to him, We stone thee not of good work, but of blasphemy, and for thou, since thou art a man, makest thyself God.

34.verse: Jesus answered to them, Whether it is not written in your law, That I said, Ye be gods?

35.verse: If he said that they were gods, to whom the word of God was made, and the scripture may not be undone,

36.verse: that that the Father hath hallowed, and hath sent into the world [which the Father hallowed, and sent into the world], ye say, That thou blasphemest, for I said, I am God's Son?

37.verse: If I do not the works of my Father, do not ye believe to me;

38.verse: but if I do, though ye will not believe to me, believe ye to the works; that ye know and believe, that the Father is in me, and I in the Father.

39.verse: Therefore they sought to take him, and he went out of their hands.

40.verse: And he went again over Jordan, into that place where John was first baptizing, and he dwelt there.

41.verse: And many came to him, and said, For John did no miracle [Forsooth John did no sign, or miracle]; and all things whatever John said of this, were sooth.

1.verse: And there was a sick man [Forsooth there was some sick man], Lazarus of Bethany, of the castle of Mary and Martha, his sisters.

2.verse: And it was Mary, which anointed the Lord with ointment, and wiped his feet with her hairs, whose brother Lazarus was sick.

3.verse: Therefore his sisters sent to him, and said [saying], Lord, lo! he whom thou lovest, is sick.

4.verse: And Jesus heard, and said to them, This sickness is not to the death, but for the glory of God, that man's Son be glorified by him [that God's Son be glorified by it].

5.verse: And Jesus loved Martha, and her sister Mary, and Lazarus.

6.verse: Therefore when Jesus heard, that he was sick, then he dwelled in the same place two days.

7.verse: And after these things he said to his disciples, Go we again into Judaea.

8.verse: The disciples say to him, Master [Rabbi, or Master], now the Jews sought to stone thee, and again goest thou thither?

9.verse: Jesus answered, Whether there be not twelve hours of the day? If any man wander in the day, he hurteth not, for he seeth the light of this world. [Jesus answered, Whether there be not twelve hours in the day? Whosoever walketh in the day, he hurteth not, for he seeth the light of this world.]

10.verse: But if he wander in the night, he stumbleth, for light is not in him.

11.verse: He said these things [These things he saith], and after these things he saith to them, Lazarus, our friend, sleepeth, but I go to raise him from sleep.

12.verse: Therefore his disciples said, Lord, if he sleepeth, he shall be safe. [Therefore his disciples said, Lord, if he sleep, he shall be safe.]

13.verse: But Jesus had said of his death; but they guessed, that he said of [the] sleeping of sleep.

14.verse: Then therefore Jesus said to them openly, Lazarus is dead;

15.verse: and I have joy for you, that ye believe, for I was not there; but go we to him.

16.verse: Therefore Thomas, that is said Didymus, said to even-disciples, Go we also, that we die with him.

17.verse: And so Jesus came, and found him having then four days in the grave. [And so Jesus came, and found him having now four days in the grave.]

18.verse: And Bethany was beside Jerusalem, as it were fifteen furlongs.

19.verse: And many of the Jews came to Mary and Martha, to comfort them of their brother.

20.verse: Therefore as Martha heard, that Jesus came, she ran to him; but Mary sat at home.

21.verse: Therefore Martha said to Jesus, Lord, if thou haddest been here, my brother had not be dead.

22.verse: But now I know, that whatever things thou shalt ask of God, God shall give to thee.

23.verse: Jesus saith to her, Thy brother shall rise again.

24.verse: Martha saith to him, I know, that he shall rise again in the again-rising in the last day.

25.verse: Jesus saith to her, I am again-rising and life; he that believeth in me, yea, though he be dead, he shall live;

26.verse: and each that liveth, and believeth in me, shall not die without end . Believest thou this thing?

27.verse: She saith to him, Yea, Lord, I have believed, that thou art Christ, the Son of the living God, that hast come into this world.

28.verse: And when she had said this thing, she went, and called Mary, her sister, in silence, and said [she went, and called Mary, her sister, in silence, or stillness, saying], The master is come, and calleth thee.

29.verse: She, as she heard, arose at once [rose anon], and came to him.

30.verse: And Jesus came not yet into the castle, but he was yet in that place, where Martha had come to meet him.

31.verse: Therefore the Jews that were with her in the house, and comforted her, when they saw Mary, that she rose swiftly, and went out, they followed her, and said [when they saw Mary, for soon she rose, and went out, followed her, saying], For she goeth to the grave, to weep there.

32.verse: But when Mary was come where Jesus was, she seeing him felled down to his feet [seeing him fell down to this feet], and said to him, Lord, if thou haddest been here, my brother had not be dead.

33.verse: Therefore when Jesus saw her weeping, and the Jews weeping that were with her, he made noise in spirit, and troubled himself,

34.verse: and said, Where have ye laid him? They said to him, Lord, come, and see.

36.verse: Therefore the Jews said, Lo! how he loved him.

37.verse: And some of them said, Whether this man that opened the eyes of the born-blind man [Whether this man that opened the eyes of the born-blind], might not make that this should not die?

38.verse: Therefore Jesus again making noise in himself, came to the grave. And there was a den, and a stone was laid thereon.

39.verse: And Jesus saith, Take ye away the stone. Martha, the sister of him that was dead, saith to him, Lord, he stinketh now, for he hath lain four days.

40.verse: Jesus saith to her, Have I not said to thee, that if thou believest [for if thou shalt believe], thou shalt see the glory of God?

41.verse: Therefore they took away the stone. And Jesus lifted up his eyes, and said, Father, I do thankings to thee, for thou hast heard me;

42.verse: and I knew, that thou evermore hearest me [forsooth, I knew, for thou ever hearest me], but for the people that standeth about, I said, that they believe, that thou hast sent me.

43.verse: When he had said these things, he cried with a great voice, Lazarus, come forth.

44.verse: And at once he that was dead, came out, bound the hands and feet with bonds, and his face bound with a sudarium. And Jesus saith to them, Unbind ye him, and suffer ye him to go forth. [And anon, he that was dead, came forth, bound the hands and feet with bonds, and his face was bound with a sudarium, or sweating cloth. Jesus saith to them, Unbind ye him, and suffer ye him for to go away.]

45.verse: Therefore many of the Jews that came to Mary and Martha, and saw what things Jesus did, believed in him.

46.verse: But some of them went to the Pharisees, and said to them, what things Jesus had done.

47.verse: Therefore the bishops and the Pharisees gathered a council against Jesus, and said, What do we? for this man doeth many miracles [for this man doeth many signs, or miracles].

48.verse: If we leave him thus, all men shall believe in him; and Romans shall come, and shall take our place and our folk [and Romans shall come, and take our place and folk].

49.verse: But one of them, Caiaphas by name, when he was bishop of that year, said to them, Ye know nothing,

50.verse: nor think, that it speedeth to you, that one man die for the people, and that all the folk perish not.

51.verse: But [Forsooth] he said not this thing of himself, but when he was bishop of that year, he prophesied, that Jesus was to die for the folk,

52.verse: and not only for the folk, but that he should gather into one the sons of God that were scattered.

53.verse: Therefore from that day they thought for to slay him.

54.verse: Therefore Jesus walked not then openly among the Jews [Therefore Jesus walked not now openly at the Jews]; but he went into a country beside [the] desert, into a city, that is said Ephraim, and there he dwelled with his disciples [and there he dwelt with his disciples].

55.verse: And the pask of the Jews was nigh, and many of the country went up to Jerusalem before the pask, to hallow themselves.

56.verse: Therefore they sought Jesus, and spake together, standing in the temple, What guess ye, for he cometh not to the feast day?

57.verse: For the bishops and the Pharisees had given a commandment, that if any man know where he is, that he show [that if any man knew where he is, he show], that they take him.

1.verse: Therefore Jesus before six days of pask came to Bethany, where Lazarus had been dead [where Lazarus was dead], whom Jesus raised.

2.verse: And they made to him a supper there, and Martha ministered to him; and Lazarus was one of the men that sat at the meat with him.

3.verse: Therefore Mary took a pound of ointment of true nard precious [Therefore Mary took a pound of ointment spikenard, or true nard, precious], and anointed the feet of Jesus, and wiped his feet with her hairs; and the house was full-filled with the savour of the ointment.

4.verse: Therefore Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples, that was to betray him, said,

5.verse: Why is not this ointment sold for three hundred pence, and given to poor men [and given to needy men]?

6.verse: But he said this thing, not for it pertained to him of needy men, but for he was a thief, and had the purses, and bare those things that were sent.

7.verse: Therefore Jesus said, Suffer ye her, that into the day of my burying she keep that;

8.verse: for ye shall evermore have poor men with you, but ye shall not evermore have me.

9.verse: Therefore much people of the Jews knew, that Jesus was there; and they came, not only for Jesus, but to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from death [whom he raised from dead].

10.verse: But the princes of priests thought [for] to slay Lazarus,

11.verse: for many of the Jews went away for him [for many of the Jews for him went away], and believed in Jesus.

12.verse: But on the morrow much people, that came together to the feast day, when they had heard, that Jesus came to Jerusalem [when they had heard, for Jesus cometh to Jerusalem],

13.verse: took branches of palms, and came forth to meet him, and cried, Hosanna, blessed is the king of Israel, that cometh in the name of the Lord.

14.verse: And Jesus found a young ass, and sat on [upon] him, as it is written,

15.verse: The daughter of Sion, do not thou dread; lo! thy king cometh, sitting on an ass's foal. [Daughter of Sion, do not thou dread; lo! thy king cometh, sitting on the colt of a she ass.]

16.verse: His disciples knew not first these things, but when Jesus was glorified, then they had mind [then they recorded, or had mind], that these things were written of him, and these things they did to him.

17.verse: Therefore the people bare witnessing, that was with him, when he called Lazarus from the grave, and raised him from death [from dead].

18.verse: And therefore the people came, and met with him, for they heard that he had done this sign.

19.verse: Therefore the Pharisees said to themselves, Ye see, that we profit nothing; lo! all the world hath gone after him [lo! all the world went after him].

20.verse: And there were some heathen men, of them that had come up to worship in the feast day.

21.verse: And these came to Philip, that was of Bethsaida of Galilee, and prayed him, and said, Sire, we will see Jesus [and prayed him, saying, Sire, we would see Jesus].

22.verse: Philip cometh, and saith to Andrew; and again Andrew and Philip said to Jesus.

23.verse: And Jesus answered to them, and said [saying], The hour cometh, that man's Son be clarified.

24.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, but a corn of wheat fall into the earth, and be dead, it dwelleth alone; but if it be dead, it bringeth [forth] much fruit.

25.verse: He that loveth his life, shall lose it; and he that hateth his life in this world, keepeth it into everlasting life.

26.verse: If any man serve me, follow he me; and where I am, there my minister shall be [there and my minister, or servant, shall be]. If any man serve me, my Father shall honour him [my Father shall worship him].

27.verse: Now my soul is troubled, and what shall I say? Father, save me from this hour; but therefore [but for that thing] I came into this hour;

28.verse: Father, clarify thy name. And a voice came from heaven, and said [saying], And I have clarified, and again I shall clarify.

29.verse: Therefore the people that stood, and heard, said, that thunder was made; other men said, an angel spake to him.

30.verse: Jesus answered, and said, This voice came not for me, but for you.

31.verse: Now is the doom of the world, now the prince of this world shall be cast out.

32.verse: And if I shall be enhanced from the earth, I shall draw all things to myself.

33.verse: And he said this thing [Soothly this thing he said], signifying by what death he was to die.

34.verse: And the people answered to him, We have heard of the law, that Christ dwelleth without end [for Christ dwelleth into without end]; and how sayest thou, It behooveth man's Son to be areared? Who is this man's Son?

35.verse: And then Jesus saith to them, Yet a little light is in you; walk ye, the while ye have light, that darkness catch you not [that darknesses catch not you]; he that wandereth in darknesses, knoweth not whither he goeth.

36.verse: While ye have light, believe ye in the light, that ye be the children of light. Jesus spake these things, and went, and hid him(self) from them.

37.verse: And when he had done so many miracles before them [Soothly when he had done so many signs, or miracles, before them], they believed not in him;

38.verse: that the word of Esaias, the prophet, should be fulfilled, which he said, Lord, who hath believed to our hearing, and to whom is the arm of the Lord showed?

39.verse: Therefore they might not believe, for again Esaias said,

40.verse: He hath blinded their eyes, and hath made hard the heart of them [and he hath endured, or made hard, the heart of them], that they see not with eyes, and understand [not] with heart; and that they be converted, and I heal them.

41.verse: Esaias said these things, when he saw the glory of him, and spake of him.

42.verse: Nevertheless of the princes many believed in him, but for the Pharisees they acknowledged not, that they should not be put out of the synagogue;

43.verse: for they loved the glory of men, more than the glory of God.

44.verse: And Jesus cried, and said, He that believeth in me, believeth not in me, but in him that sent me.

45.verse: He that seeth me, seeth him that sent me.

46.verse: I light came into the world, that each that believeth in me, dwell not in darknesses.

47.verse: And if any man heareth my words, and keepeth them not, I deem him not [And if any man shall hear my words, and shall not keep, I deem not him]; for I came not, that I deem the world, but that I make the world safe.

48.verse: He that despiseth me, and taketh not my words, hath him that shall judge him; that word that I have spoken, [that] shall deem him in the last day [the word that I have spoken, that shall deem him in the last day].

49.verse: For I have not spoken of myself, but that Father that sent me, [he] gave to me a commandment, what I shall say, and what I shall speak.

50.verse: And I know, that his commandment is everlasting life; therefore those things that I speak, as the Father said to me, so I speak.

1.verse: But before the feast day of pask Jesus witting, that his hour is come, that he pass from this world to the Father [Jesus witting, for his hour cometh, that he pass over this world to the Father], when he had loved his that were in the world, into the end he loved them.

2.verse: And when the supper was made, when the devil had put then into the heart, that Judas of Simon Iscariot should betray him, [And the supper made, when the devil had sent now into the heart of Judas, of Simon Iscariot, that he should betray him,]
