3.verse: he witting that the Father gave all things to him into his hands, and that he went out from God, and goeth to God,

4.verse: he riseth from the supper, and doeth off his clothes; and when he had taken a linen cloth, he girded him(self).

5.verse: And afterward he put water into a basin, and began to wash the disciples' feet, and to wipe with the linen cloth, with which he was girded.

6.verse: And so he came to Simon Peter, and Peter saith to him, Lord, washest thou my feet?

7.verse: Jesus answered, and said to him, What I do, thou knowest not now; but thou shalt know afterward.

8.verse: Peter saith to him, Thou shalt never wash my feet. Jesus answered to him, If I shall not wash thee, thou shalt not have part with me.

9.verse: Simon Peter saith to him, Lord, not only my feet, but both the hands and the head [but and mine hands and the head].

10.verse: Jesus saith to him, He that is washed, hath no need but that he wash the feet, but he is all clean [but he is clean all]; and ye be clean, but not all.

11.verse: For he knew, who it was that should betray him [Forsooth he knew, who should betray him]; therefore he said, Ye be not all clean.

12.verse: And so after that he had washed their feet, he took his clothes; and when he was set to meat again, again he said to them, Ye know what I have done to you. [Therefore after that he had washed the feet of them, he took his clothes; and when he had rested again, again he said to them, Know ye what I have done to you(?)]

13.verse: Ye call me master and Lord, and ye say well; for I am.

14.verse: Therefore if I, Lord and master, have washed your feet, and ye shall wash one another's feet [and ye owe to wash another the tother's feet];

15.verse: for I have given to you ensample, that as I have done to you, so do ye. [for I have given example to you, that as I have done to you, so and ye do.]

16.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, the servant is not greater than his lord, neither an apostle is greater than he that sent him.

17.verse: If ye know these things, ye shall be blessed, if ye do them.

18.verse: I say not of you all, I know which I have chosen [I know whom I have chosen]; but that the scripture be fulfilled, He that eateth my bread, shall raise his heel against me.

19.verse: Truly, I say to you before it be done, that when it is done, ye believe that I am.

20.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, he that taketh whomever I shall send, receiveth me; and he that receiveth me, receiveth him that sent me.

21.verse: When Jesus had said these things, he was troubled in spirit, and witnessed, and said, Truly, truly, I say to you, that one of you shall betray me.

22.verse: Therefore the disciples looked together, doubting of whom he said.

23.verse: And so one of his disciples was resting in the bosom of Jesus, whom Jesus loved.

24.verse: Therefore Simon Peter beckoned to him, and said to him, Who is it, of whom he saith?

25.verse: And so when he had rested again on the breast of Jesus, he saith to him, Lord, who is it?

26.verse: Jesus answered, He it is, to whom I shall areach a sop of bread. And when he had wet bread, he gave to Judas of Simon Iscariot. [Jesus answered, He it is, to whom I shall dress bread dipped in. And when he had dipped in bread, he gave to Judas of Simon Iscariot.]

27.verse: And after the morsel, then Satan entered into him. And Jesus saith to him, That thing that thou doest, do thou swiftly.

28.verse: And none of them that sat at the meat knew, whereto he said to him. [Forsooth no man sitting at the meat knew this thing, to what thing he said to him.]

29.verse: For some guessed, for Judas had purses, that Jesus had said to him, Buy thou those things, that be needful to us to the feast day [that be needful to us at the feast day], or that he should give something to needy men.

30.verse: Therefore when he had taken the morsel, he went out at once [he went out anon]; and it was night.

31.verse: Therefore when he was gone out, Jesus said, Now man's Son is clarified, and God is clarified in him.

32.verse: If God is clarified in him, and God shall clarify him in himself, and at once [and anon] he shall clarify him.

33.verse: Little sons, yet a little I am with you; ye shall seek me, and, as I said to the Jews, Whither I go, ye be not able to come [Whither I go, ye may not come]; and to you I say now.

34.verse: I give to you a new commandment, that ye love together, as I have loved you, and that ye love together [that ye love together, as I loved you, that and ye love together].

35.verse: In this thing all men shall know, that ye be my disciples, if ye have love together.

36.verse: Simon Peter saith to him, Lord, whither goest thou? Jesus answered, Whither I go, thou mayest not follow me now, but thou shalt follow me afterward.

37.verse: Peter saith to him, Why may I not follow thee now? I shall put my life for thee.

38.verse: Jesus answered, Thou shalt put thy life for me? Truly, truly, I say to thee, the cock shall not crow, till thou shalt deny me thrice.

1.verse: Be not your heart afraid [Be not your heart distroubled], nor dread it; ye believe in God, and believe ye in me.

2.verse: In the house of my Father be many dwellings; if any thing less, I had said to you [if any thing less, I should have said to you], for I go to make ready to you a place.

3.verse: And if I go, and make ready to you a place, again I come, and I shall take you to myself, that where I am, ye be.

4.verse: And whither I go, ye know, and ye know the way.

5.verse: Thomas saith to him, Lord, we know not whither thou goest, and how be we able to know the way [and how may we know the way]?

6.verse: Jesus saith to him, I am way, truth, and life; no man cometh to the Father, but by me.

7.verse: If ye had known me, soothly ye had known also my Father; and afterward ye shall know him, and ye have seen him.

8.verse: Philip saith to him, Lord, show to us the Father, and it sufficeth to us.

9.verse: Jesus saith to him, So long time I am with you, and have ye not known me? Philip, he that seeth me, seeth also the Father. How sayest thou, show to us the Father?

10.verse: Believest thou not, that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me? The words that I speak to you, I speak not of myself; but the Father himself that dwelleth in me, [he] doeth the works.

11.verse: Believe ye not, that I am in the Father, and the Father is in me? Else believe ye for those works.

12.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, if a man believeth in me [Truly, truly, I say to you, he that believeth in me], also he shall do the works that I do; and he shall do greater works than these, for I go to the Father.

13.verse: And whatever thing ye [shall] ask the Father in my name, I shall do this thing, that the Father be glorified in the Son.

14.verse: If ye [shall] ask any thing in my name, I shall do it.

15.verse: If ye love me, keep ye my commandments.

16.verse: And I shall pray the Father, and he shall give to you another comforter, the Spirit of truth, to dwell with you without end; [And I shall pray the Father, and he shall give to you another comforter, that he dwell with you into without end;]

17.verse: which Spirit the world may not take [the Spirit of truth, which Spirit the world may not take], for it seeth him not, neither knoweth him. But ye shall know him, for he shall dwell with you, and he shall be in you.

18.verse: I shall not leave you fatherless, I shall come to you.

19.verse: Yet a little, and the world seeth not now me [Yet a little, and the world seeth not me now]; but ye shall see me, for I live, and ye shall live.

20.verse: In that day ye shall know, that I am in my Father, and ye in me, and I in you.

21.verse: He that hath my commandments, and keepeth them, he it is that loveth me; and he that loveth me, shall be loved of my Father, and I shall love him, and I shall show to him myself.

22.verse: Judas saith to him, not he of Iscariot, Lord, what is done, that thou shalt show thyself to us, and not to the world?

23.verse: Jesus answered, and said to him, If any man loveth me, he shall keep my word [he shall keep my words]; and my Father shall love him, and we shall come to him, and we shall dwell with him [and we shall make a dwelling at him].

24.verse: He that loveth me not, keepeth not my words; and the word which ye have heard, is not mine, but the Father's, that sent me.

25.verse: These things I have spoken to you, dwelling among you;

26.verse: but that Holy Ghost, the comforter, whom the Father shall send in my name, he shall teach you all things, and shall show to you all things, whatever things I shall say to you [he shall teach you all things, and shall show, or remember, to you all things, whatever I shall say to you].

27.verse: Peace I leave to you, my peace I give to you; not as the world giveth, I give to you; be not your heart afraid, nor dread it [be not your heart troubled, neither dread it].

28.verse: Ye have heard, that I said to you, I go, and come to you. If ye loved me, forsooth ye should have joy [If ye loved me, forsooth ye should joy], for I go to the Father, for the Father is greater than I.

29.verse: And now I have said to you, before that it be done [before it be done], that when it is done, ye believe.

30.verse: Now I shall not speak many things with you; for the prince of this world cometh, and hath not in me any thing [and he hath not any thing in me].

31.verse: But that the world know, that I love the Father; and as the Father gave a commandment to me, so I do. Rise ye, go we hence.

1.verse: I am a very vine, and my Father is an earth-tiller.

2.verse: Each branch in me that beareth not fruit, he shall take away it [he shall do it away]; and each that beareth fruit, he shall purge it, that it bear the more fruit [that it bear more fruit].

3.verse: Now ye be clean, for the word that I have spoken to you.

4.verse: Dwell ye in me, and I in you; as a branch may not make fruit of itself, but it dwell in the vine, so neither ye, but ye dwell in me.

5.verse: I am the vine, ye be the branches. Who that dwelleth in me, and I in him, this beareth much fruit, for without me, ye be able to nothing do.

6.verse: If any man dwelleth not in me, he shall be cast out as a branch, and shall wax dry; and they shall gather him, and they shall cast him into the fire, and he shall burn [and he burneth].

7.verse: If ye dwell in me, and my words dwell in you, whatever thing ye will [whatever thing ye shall desire], ye shall ask, and it shall be done to you.

8.verse: In this thing my Father is clarified, that ye bring forth full much fruit, and that ye be made my disciples.

9.verse: As my Father loved me, I have loved you; dwell ye in my love.

10.verse: If ye keep my commandments, ye shall dwell in my love; as I have kept the commandments of my Father, and dwell in his love.

11.verse: These things I spake to you, that my joy be in you, and your joy be full-filled [and your joy be filled].

12.verse: This is my commandment, that ye love together, as I have loved you.

13.verse: No man hath more love than this, that a man put his life for his friends.

14.verse: Ye be my friends if ye do those things, that I command to you.

15.verse: Now I shall not call you servants, for the servant knoweth not, what his lord shall do; but I have called you friends, for all things whatever I heard of my Father, I have made known to you.

16.verse: Ye have not chosen me, but I chose you; and I have put you [and put you], that ye go, and bring forth fruit, and your fruit dwell; that whatever thing ye [shall] ask the Father in my name, he give to you.

17.verse: These things I command to you, that ye love together.

18.verse: If the world hate you, know ye, that it had me in hate rather than you [know ye, for it had me in hate first than you].

19.verse: If ye had been of the world, the world should love that thing that was his; but for ye be not of the world, but I chose you from the world, therefore the world hateth you.

20.verse: Have ye mind of my word, which I said to you [that I said to you], The servant is not greater than his lord. If they have pursued me, they shall pursue you also; if they have kept my word, they shall keep yours also.

21.verse: But they shall do to you all these things for my name, for they know not him that sent me.

22.verse: If I had not come, and had not spoken to them, they should not have sin; but now they have none excusation of their sin [forsooth now they have not excusing of their sin].

23.verse: He that hateth me, hateth also my Father.

24.verse: If I had not done the works in them, which none other man did, they should not have sin; but now both they have seen, and hated/have hated me and my Father.

25.verse: But that the word be fulfilled, that is written in their law, For they had me in hate without cause.

26.verse: But when the comforter shall come, which I shall send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth, which cometh forth of the Father [which proceedeth, or cometh forth, of the Father], he shall bear witnessing of me;

27.verse: and ye shall bear witnessing, for ye be with me from the beginning.

1.verse: These things I have spoken to you, that ye be not caused to stumble [that ye be not offended].

2.verse: They shall make you without the synagogues, but the hour cometh, that each man that slayeth you, deem that he doeth service to God.

3.verse: And they shall do to you these things, for they have not known the Father, neither me.

4.verse: But these things I spake to you, that when the hour of them shall come, ye have mind, that I said to you. I said not to you these things from the beginning, for I was with you.

5.verse: And now I go to him that sent me, and no man of you asketh me, Whither goest thou?

6.verse: but for I have spoken to you these things, heaviness hath full-filled your heart [sorrow, or heaviness, hath full-filled your heart].

7.verse: But I say to you truth, it speedeth to you, that I go; for if I go not forth [soothly if I shall not go away], the comforter shall not come to you; but if I go forth [forsooth if I shall go away], I shall send him to you.

8.verse: And when he cometh [And when he shall come], he shall reprove the world of sin, and of rightwiseness, and of doom.

9.verse: Of sin, for they have not believed in me;

10.verse: and of rightwiseness, for I go to the Father, and now ye shall not see me;

11.verse: but of doom, for the prince of this world is now deemed.

12.verse: Yet I have many things to say to you, but ye be not able to bear them now.

13.verse: But when the Spirit of truth cometh [shall come], he shall teach you all truth; for he shall not speak of himself, but whatever things he shall hear, he shall speak; and he shall tell to you those things [and he shall tell to you the things] that be to come.

14.verse: He shall clarify me, for of mine he shall take, and shall tell to you.

15.verse: All things, whatever [things] the Father hath, be mine; therefore I said to you, that of mine he shall take, and shall tell to you.

16.verse: A little, and then ye shall not see me; and again a little, and ye shall see me, for I go to the Father.

17.verse: Therefore some of his disciples said together, What is this thing that he saith to us, A little, and ye shall not see me; and again a little, and ye shall see me, for I go to the Father?

18.verse: Therefore they said, What is this that he saith to us, A little? we know not what he speaketh.

19.verse: And Jesus knew, that they would ask him, and he said to them, Of this thing ye seek among you, for I said, A little, and ye shall not see me; and again a little, and ye shall see me.

20.verse: Truly, truly, I say to you, that ye shall mourn and weep, but the world shall have joy; and ye shall be sorrowful, but your sorrow shall turn into joy.

21.verse: A woman when she beareth child, hath heaviness [hath sorrow, or heaviness], for her time is come; but when she hath born a son, now she thinketh not on the pain, for joy, for a man is born into the world.

22.verse: And therefore ye have now sorrow, but again I shall see you, and your heart shall have joy, and no man shall take from you your joy.

23.verse: And in that day ye shall not ask me any thing; truly, truly, I say to you, if ye ask the Father any thing in my name, he shall give [it] to you.

24.verse: Till now ye asked nothing in my name; ask ye, and ye shall take, that your joy be full.

25.verse: I have spoken to you these things in proverbs; the hour cometh, when now I shall not speak to you in proverbs, but openly of my Father I shall tell to you [I shall tell you].

26.verse: In that day ye shall ask in my name; and I say not to you, that I shall pray the Father for you;

27.verse: for the Father himself loveth you, for ye have loved me, and have believed, that I went out from God.

28.verse: I went out from the Father, and I came into the world; again I leave the world, and go to the Father.

29.verse: His disciples said to him, Lo! now thou speakest openly, and thou sayest no proverb.

30.verse: Now we know, that thou knowest all things; and it is not need to thee [and it is no need to thee], that any man ask thee. In this thing we believe, that thou wentest out from God.

31.verse: Jesus answered to them, Now ye believe.

32.verse: Lo! the hour cometh, and now it cometh, that ye be scattered, each into his own things, and that ye leave me alone; and I am not alone, for the Father is with me.

33.verse: These things I have spoken to you, that ye have peace in me; in the world ye shall have dis-ease [in the world ye shall have pressing, or overlaying], but trust ye, I have overcome the world.

1.verse: These things Jesus spake, and when he had cast up his eyes into heaven [and the eyes lifted up to heaven], he said, Father, the hour cometh, clarify thy Son, that thy Son clarify thee.

2.verse: As thou hast given to him power on each flesh, that all thing that thou hast given to him, he give to them everlasting life.

3.verse: And this is everlasting life, that they know thee very God alone [that they know thee alone very God], and whom thou hast sent, Jesus Christ.

4.verse: I have clarified thee on the earth, I have ended the work, that thou hast given to me to do.

5.verse: And now, Father, clarify thou me at thyself, with the clearness that I had at thee, before the world was made.

6.verse: I have showed thy name to those men, which thou hast given to me of the world [I have showed thy name to the men, whom thou hast given to me of the world]; they were thine, and thou hast given them to me, and they have kept thy word.

7.verse: And now they have known, that all things that thou hast given to me, be of thee.

8.verse: For the words that thou hast given to me, I gave to them; and they have taken, and have known verily, that I went out from thee; and they believed, that thou sentest me.

9.verse: I pray for them, I pray not for the world, but for them that thou hast given to me, for they be thine.

10.verse: And all my things be thine, and thy things be mine [And all mine things be thine, and thine things be mine]; and I am clarified in them.

11.verse: And now I am not in the world, and these be in the world, and I come to thee. Holy Father, keep them in thy name, which thou hast given to me [whom thou hast given to me], that they be one, as we be.

12.verse: While I was with them, I kept them in thy name; those that thou gavest to me, I kept, and none of them perished, but the son of perdition, that the scripture be fulfilled.

13.verse: But now I come to thee, and I speak these things in the world [and these things I speak in the world], that they have my joy fulfilled in themselves.

14.verse: I gave to them thy word, and the world had them in hate; for they be not of the world, as I am not of the world.

15.verse: I pray not, that thou take them away from the world, but that thou keep them from evil.

16.verse: They be not of the world, as I am not of the world.

17.verse: Hallow thou them in truth; thy word is truth.

18.verse: As thou sentest me into the world, also I sent them into the world.

19.verse: And I hallow myself for them, that also they be hallowed in truth.

20.verse: And I pray not only for them, but also for them that shall believe into me by the word of them;

21.verse: that all be one [that all they be one], as thou, Father, in me, and I in thee, that also they in us be one; that the world believe, that thou hast sent me.

22.verse: And I have given to them the clearness, that thou hast given to me, that they be one, as we be one;

23.verse: I in them, and thou in me, that they be ended into one; and that the world know, that thou sentest me, and hast loved them, as thou hast loved also me.

24.verse: Father, they which thou hast given to me, I will that where I am, that they be with me, that they see my clearness, that thou hast given to me [Father, I will that and they whom thou hast given to me, be with me where I am, that they see my clearness, which thou hast given to me]; for thou lovedest me before the making of the world.

25.verse: Father, rightfully the world knew thee not [Rightful Father, the world knew not thee], but I knew thee, and these knew, that thou sentest me.

26.verse: And I have made thy name known to them, and shall make known; that the love by which thou hast loved me, be in them, and I in them.

1.verse: When Jesus had said these things, he went out with his disciples over the strand of Cedron, where was a yard, or a garden, into which he entered, and his disciples.

2.verse: And Judas, that betrayed him, knew the place, for oft Jesus came thither with his disciples.

3.verse: Therefore when Judas had taken a company of knights, and ministers of the bishops and of the Pharisees, he came thither with lanterns, and brands, and arms.

4.verse: And so Jesus witting all things that were to come on him, went forth, and said to them, Whom seek ye?

5.verse: They answered to him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus saith to them, I am. And Judas that betrayed him, stood with them.

6.verse: And when he said to them, I am, they went aback, and fell down on the earth.

7.verse: And again he asked them, Whom seek ye? And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.

8.verse: He answered to them, I said to you, that I am; therefore if ye seek me, suffer ye these to go away.

9.verse: That the word which he said should be fulfilled, For I lost not any of them, which thou hast given to me.

10.verse: Therefore Simon Peter had a sword, and drew it out [Therefore Simon Peter having a sword, drew it out], and smote the servant of the bishop, and cut off his right ear. And the name of the servant was Malchus.

11.verse: Therefore Jesus said to Peter, Put thou thy sword into thy sheath [Send thou the sword into the sheath]; wilt thou not, that I drink the cup, that my Father gave to me?

12.verse: Therefore the company of knights, and the tribune, and the ministers of the Jews, took Jesus, and bound him,

13.verse: and led him first to Annas [and led him to Annas first]; for he was [the] father of Caiaphas' wife, that was bishop of that year.

14.verse: And it was Caiaphas, that gave counsel to the Jews, that it speedeth, that one man die for the people.

15.verse: But Simon Peter followed Jesus, and another disciple; and that disciple was known to the bishop. And he entered [in] with Jesus, into the hall of the bishop;

16.verse: but Peter stood at the door withoutforth. Therefore that other disciple, that was known to the bishop, went out, and said to the woman that kept the door, and brought in Peter.

17.verse: And the damsel, keeper of the door, said to Peter, Whether thou art also of this man's disciples? He said, I am not.

18.verse: And the servants and [the] ministers stood at the coals, for it was cold, and they warmed them(selves); and Peter was with them, standing and warming him(self).

19.verse: And the bishop asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his teaching.

20.verse: Jesus answered to him, I have spoken openly to the world; I taught evermore in the synagogue, and in the temple, whither all the Jews came together, and in huddles I spake nothing .

21.verse: What askest thou me? ask them that heard me, what I have spoken to them; lo! they know, what things I have said.

22.verse: When he had said these things, one of the ministers standing nigh, gave a buffet to Jesus, and said [saying], Answerest thou so to the bishop?

23.verse: Jesus answered to him, If I have spoken evil, bear thou witnessing of evil; but if I said well, why smitest thou me?

24.verse: And Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas, the bishop.

25.verse: And Simon Peter stood, and warmed him(self); and they said to him [therefore they said to him], Whether also thou art his disciple? He denied, and said, I am not.

26.verse: One of the bishop's servants, cousin of him, whose ear Peter cut off, said, Saw I thee not in the yard with him [said, Whether I saw not thee in the garden with him]?

27.verse: And Peter again denied, and at once [and anon] the cock crew.

28.verse: Then they led Jesus to Caiaphas (from Caiaphas), into the moot hall; and it was early, and they entered not into the moot hall, that they should not be defouled, but that they should eat pask.

29.verse: Therefore Pilate went out withoutforth to them, and said, What accusing bring ye against this man?

30.verse: They answered, and said to him, If this were not a misdoer, we had not betaken him to thee.

31.verse: Then Pilate saith to them, Take ye him, and deem ye him, after your law. And the Jews said to him [Therefore they said to him], It is not leaveful to us to slay any man;

32.verse: that the word of Jesus should be fulfilled, which he said, signifying by what death he should die.

33.verse: Therefore again Pilate entered into the moot hall, and called Jesus, and said to him, Art thou king of Jews?

34.verse: Jesus answered, and said to him, Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or others have said to thee of me [Sayest thou this thing of thyself, or others said to thee of me]?

35.verse: Pilate answered, Whether I am a Jew? Thy folk and the bishops betook thee to me; what hast thou done?

36.verse: Jesus answered, My kingdom is not of this world; if my kingdom were of this world, my ministers would strive, that I should not be taken to the Jews; but now my kingdom is not here [now forsooth my kingdom is not of hence].

37.verse: And so Pilate said to him, Then art thou a king? Jesus answered, Thou sayest, that I am a king. To this thing I am born, and to this I came into the world, to bear witnessing to truth [and to this I came into the world, that I bear witnessing to truth]. Each [man] that is of truth, heareth my voice.

38.verse: Pilate saith to him, What is truth? And when he had said this thing, again he went out to the Jews, and said to them, I find no cause in him [I find no cause against him].

39.verse: But it is a custom to you, that I deliver one to you in pask; therefore will ye that I deliver to you the king of Jews? [Forsooth it is a custom to you, that I let go, or deliver, one to you in pask; therefore will ye that I dismiss to you the king of Jews?]

40.verse: All they cried again, and said [saying], Not this, but Barabbas. And Barabbas was a thief.

1.verse: Therefore Pilate took then Jesus, and scourged him. [Therefore then Pilate took Jesus, and scourged.]

2.verse: And knights wreathed a crown of thorns, and set [put] on his head, and did about him a cloak of purple [a cloth of purple], and came to him,

3.verse: and said, Hail, king of Jews. And they gave to him buffets.

4.verse: Again Pilate went out, and said to them, Lo! I bring him out to you [Lo! I lead him to you withoutforth], that ye know, that I find no cause in him.

5.verse: And so Jesus went out, bearing a crown of thorns, and a cloak of purple [and a cloth of purple]. And he saith to them, Lo! the man.

6.verse: But when the bishops and ministers had seen him, they cried, and said [saying], Crucify, crucify him. Pilate saith to them, Take ye him, and crucify ye [him], for I find no cause in him.

7.verse: The Jews answered to him, We have a law, and by the law he oweth to die, for he made him(self) God's Son [for he made him God's Son].

8.verse: Therefore when Pilate had heard this word, he dreaded the more [he dreaded more].

9.verse: And he went into the moot hall again, and said to Jesus, Of whence art thou? But Jesus gave none answer to him [Forsooth Jesus gave not answer to him].

10.verse: Pilate saith to him, Speakest thou not to me? Knowest thou not, that I have power to crucify thee, and I have power to deliver thee?

11.verse: Jesus answered, Thou shouldest not have any power against me, but it were given to thee from above; therefore he that betook me to thee, hath the more sin.

12.verse: From that time Pilate sought to deliver him; but the Jews cried, and said, If thou deliverest this man, thou art not the emperor's friend; for each man that maketh himself king, gainsaith the emperor.

13.verse: And Pilate [Therefore Pilate], when he had heard these words, led Jesus forth, and sat for doomsman in a place, that is said Lycostratos, but in Hebrew Golgotha (but in Hebrew, Gabbatha).

14.verse: And it was pask eve [Forsooth it was the making ready, or even, of pask], as it were the sixth hour. And he saith to the Jews, Lo! your king.

15.verse: But they cried, and said, Take away, take away; crucify him [Forsooth they cried, saying, Do away, do away; crucify him]. Pilate saith to them, Shall I crucify your king? The bishops answered, We have no king but the emperor [We have no king no but Caesar].

16.verse: And then Pilate betook him to them [Therefore then Pilate betook him to them], that he should be crucified. And they took Jesus, and led him out.

17.verse: And he bare to himself a cross, and went out into that place, that is said Calvary, in Hebrew Golgotha; [And he bearing to himself a cross went out into the place, that is said of Calvary, in Hebrew Golgatha;]

18.verse: where they crucified him, and others twain with him [and others two with him], one on this side and one on that side, and Jesus in the middle.

19.verse: And Pilate wrote a title, and set on the cross [and put on the cross]; and it was written, Jesus of Nazareth, king of Jews.

20.verse: Therefore many of the Jews read this title, for the place where Jesus was crucified, was nigh the city, and it was written in Hebrew, Greek, and Latin.

21.verse: Therefore the bishops of the Jews said to Pilate, Do not thou write king of Jews, but that he said, I am king of Jews.

22.verse: Pilate answered, That that I have written, I have written.

23.verse: Therefore the knights when they had crucified him, took his clothes, and made four parts, to each knight a part, and a coat. And the coat was without seam, and woven all about [Forsooth the coat was without seam, and above woven by all].

24.verse: Therefore they said together, Cut we not it, but cast we lot [but lay we lots], whose it is; that the scripture be fulfilled, saying, They parted my clothes to them, and on my cloak they cast lot [and into my cloth thy sent lots]. And the knights did these things.

25.verse: But beside the cross of Jesus stood his mother, and the sister of his mother, Mary Cleophas, and Mary Magdalene.

26.verse: Therefore when Jesus had seen his mother, and the disciple standing, whom he loved, he saith to his mother, Woman, lo! thy son.

27.verse: Afterward he saith to the disciple, Lo! thy mother. And from that hour the disciple took her into his mother [And from that hour the disciple took her into his things].

28.verse: Afterward Jesus witting, that now all things be ended, that the scripture were fulfilled [that the scripture should be fulfilled], he saith, I thirst.

29.verse: And a vessel was set full of vinegar. And they laid in hyssop about the sponge full of vinegar, and put it to his mouth.

30.verse: Therefore when Jesus had taken the vinegar, he said, It is ended. And when his head was bowed down, he gave up the ghost/And he bowed down the head, and sent out the spirit.

31.verse: Therefore for it was pask eve, that the bodies should not abide on the cross in the sabbath, for that was a great sabbath day [Therefore for it was the making ready of pask, that the bodies should not dwell in the cross in the sabbath, for that day of sabbath was great], the Jews prayed Pilate, that the hips of them should be broken, and they [should be] taken away.

32.verse: Therefore knights came, and they brake the thighs of the first, and of the other, that was crucified with him.

33.verse: But when they were come to Jesus [Forsooth when they had come to Jesus], as they saw him dead then, they brake not his thighs;

34.verse: but one of the knights opened his side with a spear, and at once [and anon] blood and water went out.

35.verse: And he that saw, bare witnessing [thereof], and his witnessing is true; and he knoweth that he saith true things, that ye believe.

36.verse: And these things were done, that the scripture should be fulfilled, Ye shall not break a bone of him.

37.verse: And again another scripture saith, They shall see in whom they pierced through.

38.verse: But after these things Joseph of Arimathaea prayed Pilate, that he should take away the body of Jesus, for that he was a disciple of Jesus, but privily for dread of the Jews. And Pilate suffered. And so he came [Therefore he came], and took away the body of Jesus.

39.verse: And Nicodemus came also, that had come to him first by night, and brought a medley of myrrh and aloes, as it were an hundred pound. [Soothly and Nicodemus came, that had come first to Jesus by night, bearing a medley of myrrh and aloes, as an hundred pound.]

40.verse: And they took the body of Jesus, and bound it in linen clothes with sweet smelling ointments [and bound it in linen clothes with sweet ointments, or spices], as it is [the] custom to Jews for to bury.

41.verse: Now in the place where he was crucified there was a garden; and in the garden a new sepulchre, wherein was never man yet laid.

42.verse: Therefore there they put Jesus, for the vigil of Jews' feast [for the making ready of Jews], for the sepulchre was nigh.

1.verse: And in one day of the week Mary Magdalene came early to the grave, when it was yet dark . And she saw the stone moved away from the grave.

2.verse: Therefore she ran, and came to Simon Peter, and to another disciple, whom Jesus loved, and saith to them, They have taken the Lord from the grave, and we know not, where they have laid him.

3.verse: Therefore Peter went out, and that other disciple, and they came to the grave.

4.verse: And they twain ran together [Forsooth they two ran together], and that other disciple ran before Peter, and came first to the grave.

5.verse: And when he stooped, he saw the sheets lying, nevertheless he entered not [in].

6.verse: Therefore Simon Peter came following him, and he entered into the grave, and he saw the sheets laid,

7.verse: and the sudarium that was on his head, not laid with the sheets, but by itself wrapped into a place.

8.verse: Therefore then [and] that disciple that came first to the grave, entered, and saw, and believed.

9.verse: For they knew not yet the scripture, that it behooved him to rise again from death.

10.verse: Therefore the disciples went again to themselves.

11.verse: But Mary stood at the grave withoutforth weeping. And while she wept, she bowed her(self), and beheld forth into the grave.

12.verse: And she saw two angels sitting in white, one at the head and one at the feet, where the body of Jesus was laid.

13.verse: And they say to her, Woman, what weepest thou? She said to them, For they have taken away my Lord, and I know not, where they have laid him.

14.verse: When she had said these things, she turned backward [she turned aback], and saw Jesus standing, and knew not that it was Jesus.

15.verse: Jesus saith to her, Woman, what weepest thou? whom seekest thou? She guessing that he was the gardener, saith to him, Sire, if thou hast taken him up, say to me, where thou hast laid him, and I shall take him away.

16.verse: Jesus saith to her, Mary. She turned, and saith to him, Rabboni, that is to say, Master.

17.verse: Jesus saith to her, Do not thou touch me, for I have not yet ascended to my Father; but go to my brethren, and say to them, I ascend to my Father and to your Father, to my God and to your God [and say to them, I ascend to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God].

18.verse: Mary Magdalene came, telling to the disciples, That I saw the Lord, and these things he said to me.

19.verse: Therefore when it was even in that day [Therefore when eventide was in that day], [in] one of the sabbaths, and the gates were shut, where the disciples were gathered, for dread of the Jews, Jesus came, and stood in the middle of the disciples, and he saith to them, Peace to you [and said to them, Peace be to you].

20.verse: And when he had said this, he showed to them [his] hands and side; therefore the disciples joyed, for the Lord was seen.

21.verse: And he saith to them again, Peace to you; as the Father sent me, I send you. [Therefore he said to them again, Peace to you; as the Father hath sent me, and I send you.]

22.verse: When he had said this, he blew on them, and said, Take ye the Holy Ghost;

23.verse: whose sins ye forgive, those be forgiven to them [they be forgiven]; and whose sins ye withhold, those be withheld [they be withholden].

24.verse: But Thomas, one of the twelve, that is said Didymus, was not with them, when Jesus came.

25.verse: Therefore the other disciples said, We have seen the Lord. And he said to them, But I see in his hands the printing of the nails, and put my finger into the place of the nails, and put mine hand into his side, I shall not believe. [Forsooth he said to them, No but I shall see in his hands the fixing of nails, and shall send my finger into the places of the nails, and shall send mine hand into his side, I shall not believe.]

26.verse: And after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them. Jesus came, while the gates were shut [Jesus came, the gates shut], and stood in the middle, and said, Peace to you.

27.verse: Afterward he saith to Thomas, Put in here thy finger, and see mine hands, and put hither thine hand, and put [it] into my side [Bring in hither thy finger, and see mine hands, and bring to thine hand, and send, or put, it into my side], and do not thou be unbelieveful, but faithful.

28.verse: Thomas answered, and said to him, My Lord and my God.

29.verse: Jesus saith to him, Thomas, for thou hast seen me, thou believedest; blessed be they, that saw not, and have believed.

30.verse: And Jesus did many other signs in the sight of his disciples, which be not written in this book. [Forsooth and many other signs Jesus did in the sight of his disciples, the which be not written in this book.]

31.verse: But these be written, that ye believe, that Jesus is Christ, the Son of God, and that ye believing have life in his name.

1.verse: Afterward Jesus again showed him(self) to his disciples, at the sea of Tiberias. And he showed him(self) thus.

2.verse: There were together Simon Peter, and Thomas, that is said Didymus, and Nathanael, that was of the Cana of Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and twain other of his disciples [and two other of his disciples].

3.verse: Simon Peter saith to them, I go to fish. They say to him, And we come with thee. And they went out, and went into a boat. And in that night they took nothing.

4.verse: But when the morrow was come, Jesus stood in the brink; nevertheless the disciples knew not, that it was Jesus.

5.verse: Therefore Jesus saith to them, Children, whether ye have any supping thing? They answered to him, Nay.

6.verse: He said to them, Put ye [Send ye] the net into the right half of the rowing, and ye shall find. And they putted the net; and then they might not draw it for multitude of fishes [Therefore they sent the net, and now they might not draw it, for multitude of fishes].

7.verse: Therefore that disciple, whom Jesus loved, said to Peter, It is the Lord. Simon Peter, when he had heard that it is the Lord, girt him(self) with a coat, for he was naked, and went into the sea [Simon Peter, when he had heard for it was the Lord, girt him with a coat, soothly he was naked, and sent him into the sea].

8.verse: But the other disciples came by boat, for they were not far from the land, but as a two hundred cubits [but as it were two hundred cubits], drawing the net of fishes.

9.verse: And as they came down into the land, they saw coals lying, and fish laid on [and a fish put thereon], and bread.

10.verse: Jesus saith to them, Bring ye of the fishes, which ye have taken now.

11.verse: Simon Peter went up, and drew the net into the land, full of great fishes, an hundred fifty and three; and when they were so many, the net was not broken.

12.verse: Jesus saith to them, Come ye, and eat ye. And no man of them that sat at the meat, durst ask him, Who art thou, witting that it is the Lord.

13.verse: And Jesus came, and took bread, and gave to them, and fish also.

14.verse: Now this [is the] third time Jesus was showed to his disciples, when he had risen again from death [when he rose again from dead].

15.verse: And when they had eaten, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, Simon of Jonas, lovest thou me more than these? He saith to him, Yea, Lord, thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith to him, Feed thou my lambs [Feed my lambs].

16.verse: Again he saith to him, Simon of Jonas, lovest thou me? He saith to him, Yea, Lord, thou knowest that I love thee. He saith to him, Feed thou my lambs.

17.verse: He saith to him the third time, Simon of Jonas, lovest thou me? Peter was heavy [sorry], for he said to him the third time, Lovest thou me, and he saith to him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith to him, Feed my sheep.

18.verse: Truly, truly, I say to thee, when thou were younger, thou girdedest thee, and wanderedest where thou wouldest; but when thou shalt wax older, thou shalt hold forth thine hands, and another shall gird thee, and shall lead thee whither thou wilt not [and lead thee whither thou wilt not].

19.verse: He said this thing, signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had said these things, he saith to him, Follow thou me.

20.verse: Peter turned, and saw that disciple following, whom Jesus loved, which also rested in the supper on his breast, and said to him, Lord, who is it, that shall betray thee?

21.verse: Therefore when Peter had seen this disciple, he saith to Jesus, Lord, but what this [Lord, what forsooth this]?

22.verse: Jesus saith to him, So I will that he dwell till I come, what to thee? follow thou me.

23.verse: Therefore this word went out among the brethren, that that disciple dieth not. And Jesus said not to him, that he dieth not, but, So I will that he dwell till I come, what to thee?

24.verse: This is that disciple, that beareth witnessing of these things, and wrote them [that beareth witnessing of these things, and wrote these things]; and we know, that his witnessing is true.

25.verse: And there be also many other things that Jesus did, which if they be written each by himself, I deem that the world itself shall not take the books, that be to be written. [Amen.] [Forsooth there be and many other signs, or miracles, that Jesus did, the which if they be written by each by himself, I guess neither the world himself be able to take the books, that be to be written. Amen.]
